reviews: The food choices are great, if you are an omnivore. If you are vegetarian, or heaven help us, vegan, your choices for your visit are going to be very limited. Questions about the ingredients of a dish are met with blank stares.   Overall, I liked my visit. The grounds are beautifully maintained. The Spa is remarkably over priced!! I think every one means well, but a few areas are missing.   Having alcohol part of the all-inclusive isn't always a good thing. I saw way too many visitors totally blotto, and acting like complete jerks.

After 7 stays at the Cozumel iberostar, this is the last. Started coming in 2004.  My friends that travel with my husband and me are in complete agreement that in the future we will look for an all adult resort. The rooms are clean, the food good. Atmosphere wonderful and tropical. However, we are past wanting to be around tons of screaming. Unattended children.  We understand the bottom line of any business is bring in as many as you can. We don't begrudge iberostar. We also don't begrudge families for bringing their families. However, there's precious little for teenagers to do here at the resort and I feel sorry for them here. They can sit on their phone at home. Pool chairs have pool toys on them overnight saving for the chairs day after day, never giving anyone else a

Ismael is a funny guy great to be around and Rosa and Montse were very helpful. The bartender Julian is very good and helpful he works at the front desk and always makes the drinks so wonderful and amazing.

Iberostar is the best hotel I have ever been at. The employees are very welcoming and helpful. The star camp members Ismael, Rosa, Montse are very nice and help with your little kids. Also Julian is the best bartender highly recommend him.

This is a great location, especially for divers.  The dive shop is located right on site.  They offer 2 morning dives and 2 afternoon dives every day which allows for lots of flexibility for scheduling.  The Iberostar is the farthest hotel south on the island and is right on top of the best dive spots.  If you do a two tank dive, they actually come in to the dock in between dives so you can go to the bathroom and get a water or soda.  Most boat rides to the top sites were 15 minutes or less.  Great boats and dive shop.  The resort is great, it's laid out in little 4 room buildings so it feels very private.  Each has a deck with a hammock.  The beach and pool were great, we were always able to find a comfortable spot (Mid December so hotel may not have been full).  The food was

Ismael, Rosa, and Montse are the best! They have great food and amazing views here. The bartenders (Especially Julian) are polite and make great drinks for everyone. They have everything you need here including a gym, spa, and snack bar.

amazing! love the star club, food, and entertainment. We love ismael, rosa. and montse . ANGELO IS THE BEST STAR MEMBER EVEN THO HES NOT HERE. Julian is the best bartender. highly Recommend. Make sure you participate in all activities!

My friends and I stayed here for week with their diving package and it was great. The suites were adorable and clean, good food, and friendly hospitality. The diving was also absolutely incredible. Would definitely come back

Had a fantastic time with my group of friends at this all inclusive resort.  Although the rooms smelled a little musty when we first arrived, the resort was beautiful and had an assortment of tropical animals all around, including flamingos, parrots, iguanas and turtles.  The cleaning crew did an excellent job of maintaining the rooms and the main part of the resort was always clean and inviting.  2 Marias Tex Mex restaurant was delicious.  The pool bartenders, Adrian and Manuel made delicious drinks to enjoy in the sun.  Daniela & Fabian were fantastic event coordinators who took time to converse with the customers and make them feel welcome.  Reyes and Isidro in the lobby bar worked extra hard to make our night caps delicious.  Our check out day was my birthday and when the

Daniela, Manuel, Adrian, Isidro, Reyes, and Eduardo are some of the best people at this resort.  The banquet staff was outstanding, the care is top notch. I have been to dozens of countries and stayed in places from hostels to 5 star hotels, and this place has it all.  I will be back, no doubt.  Thank you so much!

I had a conference on the mainland but family and friends went early to dive. The diving was amazing.   We went to the fitness area everyday and met Manola Carmona. He was extremely knowledgeable about fitness but also the right way to train since he is also a licensed physical therapist. He took the time to map out the best exercises  for us, took us through the routine and sent us an email so we could continue at home. I expected to just have a nice workout with friends and left with a great plan that will help me in the future. I highly recommend stopping by the fitness center or one of his classes!!

What an amazing place! Over 20 of us were here for a week and couldn't ask for a better time. The hospitality and service was great. We enjoyed sitting at the beach, meeting new people and in the evening enjoying the shows provided by the resort. They have many fun activities that anyone can do. Gabriela and Alberto really know how to have fun with the crowd and keep us engaged. There are shows and games in the lobby almost every night. Don't be afraid to get involved. They might ask you to sing but don't be afraid, DJ Nancy has got your back. The bartenders and waitresses/waiters are better than any I have seen. Always checking in on you and your drink. Make sure to keep an eye out for Elisandra, her smile will brighten up your day. Overall the experience was amazing. We will

We just got back from our trip of 5 nights at Iberostar and our first time in Cozumel.  Some positives: the bungalow style resort and rooms make for a charming and quaint vibe. The entertainment at night was always fun and a wide variety from including the guests as the stars or bringing in live music/shows. The resort and rooms were clean. The amenities such as the gym were nice, we did not make it over to the spa. You could rent water sports (kayak, snorkeling) for 5 dollars for a 2 hour window.   The cons: if you are looking for a beach where you can get in and out of the water freely than this is not the resort for that, not many reviews talk about the rocky natural of the resort. You can swim in the ocean but you must walk down the dock to get there (or bring water shoes).

Manolo, our Pilates/yoga instructor was extremely impressive with his technique and leadership qualities.  He consistently reminded you to respect your body while safely pushing you to do more. Loved it! Highly recommended trying it no matter your fitness level.

I wish to take a moment to recognize the outstanding service of Glendy, a server at the buffet, Iberostar Cozumel. During a family vacation we came to exclusively sit in Glendy’s section. Friendly, attentive and in all ways a pleasure. Gracias por todo Glendy !

Greatly enjoying the resort on this second visit.  My wife tried the pilates class one day and yoga another day with Manolo. He was so good he made her want to go back to yoga again after a few years she hadn’t done some. He took time to adjust some positions, helped her to understand the exercises, all while making her work hard but at the same time she enjoyed it and relaxed. A good professional all around.

Second stay at Iberostar. Have to say that since 2017 it has only improved. The most significant improvement we saw was in the food department. We ate at the smokehouse twice, the first time the brisket was literally some of the best I've had, the second time it was a bit dry, but still good and the chicken, pulled pork and sides were all very good each time. One place of possible improvement would be the Mexican restaurant, didn't feel the food stood out here the way it did at the smokehouse or asian. The water stations are a nice addition, though some were out of order, the one in front of our room worked well. With so many using reusable containers, a possible addition could be a station to wash out bottles. After a 7 day stay you would feel better about a clean bottle after

Our family of four had a fantastic time.  This is a great place for families. There were things to do for kids of all ages, including teens. Our kids (6&8) loved Star Camp! Rosa, Ismael, and Montse are the best!

Was a nice spot. Seemed like a lot of people come to scuba dive which we did not. The snack bar was a nice spot for a quick lunch. Room was not super big but also comfortable for sleeping. Some said there room was hot but our room was also super cold.

We went as a family of 10 (all couples). It’s beautiful, amazing food, activities to do all day. The only thing I regret is not finding Daniela and Gabriela on our last day to say goodbye! They made this vacation even more fun and felt like family to us! They remembered our names all week and we learned about each others families. They were so much fun and on top of the location, i will miss them dearly. Fabian was also great-fun and taught us about the animals! Can’t forget Jose in the shop at the front! He took so much time explaining the different chocolates and what different candies were put out during Dia de Muertos. He was so patient and oh so kind. We will definitely be back (and hope Daniela, Gabriela, Jose, and Fabian will still be working there)!

Until last year, the Iberostar Cozumel always reserved the restaurant just off the beach as its evening steakhouse. They changed their menu about seven months ago and it is now a family style restaurant featuring pulled pork, beef brisket, pork sausage, and lemon chicken thighs. It was a complete and total disappointment as we were looking forward to an evening with a nice steak dinner at what the Iberostar considers to be  one of its upscale restaurants.  For what it’s worth you’re better off eating at the main dining restaurant and having a wider variety of food. Do not waste your time at this restaurant.

We just returned from 10 wonderful days at the Iberostar resort on Cozumel Mexico. This was our fourth visit in several years. We like this resort because it is smaller than some and mostly oriented toward adults since it is a magnet for Scuba divers and snorkelers.  Everything was great again this year. The grounds are well kept. Our room was well maintained and clean. Food at the various restaurants was much better than than previous visits but it was always good. The one exception was at the Oriental restaurant where the chicken in my chicken Pad Thai was tough as shoe leather. Everything else was very good. Service by the various staff was all good and everyone says hello or Good Morning and such when they pass by. Restaurant service was very good.

If you are looking for a quiet place to chillax and unwind this is your place. Food is good, staff is AMAZING, environment is set literally within the jungle with bungalow rooms (no bugs), good entertainment, pools are large even when the "cruisers" come in, the beach is gorgeous. They have filtered water stations all over the resort. They filter the water and ice. You still dont drink from the tap. The resort is a natural bird sanctuary. Lots of excursions, recommend snorkeling as it's along the 2nd largest coral reef in the world.  We did the Bar Hop, deep sea fishing and dune buggy excursions. All were well worth the money. The shoreline at the resort is all rock so you need water socks to get in. Beautiful sunsets. There is Alberto's, just a short walk down the beach which

Super nice community with lots of activities. Good food and nice people. There is lots of space at the pool and beach. The rooms are nice sized and they get cleaned everyday! The community is super nice and helpful.

I typically avoid going to gyms, but it was too hot in Cozumel to run outside, so I went to the gimnasio and I was so glad I did! Manolo was wonderful. He went out of his way to teach me about exercise and spoke with me to clarify goals I had for myself. He taught me several exercises that I can now do at home!

This was our fifth stay at Iberostar and our first since the pandemic. I can honestly say that they have improved since our last stay.  The food was exceptional, the entertainment was great, the staff is amazing and the grounds are beautiful!!!!  The resort is also environmentally conscious which is a huge plus for us.  Negative: There were two days during our stay where buses of "cruise ship guests" were dropped off at the front to use the resort.  When this occurred, there were ZERO chairs at the beach or the pool.  In addition, it created long lines at the beach bar and the beach grill ran out of food.  Some of the "cruise ship guests" were rude, loud, obnoxious. While I understand this creates additional revenue for the resort, Iberostar should focus on their paying guests

We changed to this resort last-minute after our original destination started receiving terrible reviews. Our entire stay at Iberostar was perfect. The food was fantastic, and the dining areas were never overcrowded. Pools and beach are great, with the exception of people feeling the need to reserve chairs at the pool first thing in the morning, even though it’s posted everywhere not to do so.   Having a diving shop on site made scuba and snorkeling east and accessible. The grounds and rooms are immaculate, and the nightly live music in the lobby and productions at the theater kept us entertained every evening after dinner.   If we were to return to Cozumel, we would not even look at any other resorts. Iberostar was perfect for us in every way.
Beautiful lush property with a pretty but not particularly usable beach (strong waves, lots of dark churn, only access was from rickety wooden pier).   Restaurant food good, pools big and beautiful.

I had a great time staying at the Iberostar a little over a week ago. The customer service was fantastic. Especially the employees that hosted the entertainment events and activities. Gabriela was amazing! She is very fun and has excellent energy that leads to an awesome time! She is also very nice and adaptable to anyone. I was very impressed with everything she did. She deserves a special shout out. Thank you, Gabriela, for giving me and my friends a wonderful experience! Also, the two young men that were part of the entertainment and activities did a great job too, very accommodating and inclusive for everyone at the resort to have a good time. I appreciate everything they did. They really make the entire experience an incredible one. Very good at making it feel like vacation

I have had the best experience here! The entertainment during the day is so amusing! There's so much too do and the "cruise directors" Daniela the sexy archer and then super sexy at bingo and so many other activities! Fabian is amazing, Julian was so amusing. These guys get you up to participate and that is usually not me at all. I loved that they do so many things during thhe day.

My family of three young kids did a day pass at Iberostar on a longer trip to Cozumel. The location was beautiful, and the food was very good, but it was the staff that was really incredible! Everyone at the resort was very friendly and engaging, especially the staff at the Star Camp for kids. Our kids spent the whole day at the Star Camp and really loved Rosa, Ismael, and Montserrat! They keep raving about how they want to go back and spend a whole week at Iberostar in the future. There were scheduled events for the day that were creative and varied. They also had some free play time in between. The staff were so full of energy and so patient and engaged with the kids. We knew they were in good hands, and my husband and I could enjoy some time to ourselves.

We just returned from a wonderful week at Iberostar Cozumel with a group of 12 which included 40-50 year old adults and teenagers. This was our second experience at an Iberostar property. The grounds were gorgeous and well maintained. Lots of wildlife! The pool areas were large and while the chairs filled up quickly, the pools never felt crowded. One of the reasons we chose Iberostar again was the food, and it did not disappoint! The snack shack at the pool area was open daily 10ish-5ish and had burgers, hot dogs, fries, chips and guac, assorted fruits, and salads. The chicken salad with blue cheese and apples was  my favorite. The buffets (breakfast/lunch/dinner) always had a huge selection of items that changed daily. Our absolute favorite was the night they had a fresh crepe

Our family spent a week here beginning of April - kids ages 8, 6, and 4. We had an absolute blast. Weather was perfect every day -75-85 and sunny everyday. The kids would have spent every waking moment in the pool and on the beach/in the ocean. The ocean was quite rocky near the beach and yes there is a lot of "ocean" washed up near the beach so it isnt super clear in the shallow area. Waves were more aggressive than normal from talking to some of the repeat visitors but was still enjoyable. Not going to be a great option for toddlers. I thought the food was great. Our kids are picky but still had something to enjoy at every meal. There is a Beach "restaraunt" that is open all afternoon that has burgers, hot dogs, fruit and much more - the kids just walked over and grabbed

My friend and I celebrated our 50th Birthday year with a special 10 day trip to Cozumel and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Everything from the accommodation, food and especially the wonderful staff was absolutely perfect. Set in beautiful, lovingly maintained tropical grounds right next to a picture perfect beach the Iberostar Cozumel has definitely exceeded my expectations. I loved the environmentally friendly approach and the animals who were able to wander freely (but not in a way that disturbed the guests). Our room was lovely, really comfortable  beds, very clean and the aircon worked perfectly (a welcome relief for me being English and not used to the heat). The food was excellent, plenty of choice for any palette and Iberostar have a buffet to be proud

We spent the better part of a week at Iberostar Cozumel over spring break this year with our 5 year old. It was our first time at an all inclusive. The hotel grounds are just beautiful with a lovely big pool that usually fills up but never felt too crowded, although it was sometimes crowded at the swim up bar, and the beach bar is a long trek to get a drink. Watching the sunset from the swing on the beach is like something out of a dream.  The staff across the board at the resort is friendly and eager to help. There is always plentiful food and drink. (It would be great to have a morning coffee station available closer to the pool/beach and to have more servers circulating to bring drinks to the chairs around the pool.) There is always fresh fruit, a nice salad bar and plentiful

Excellent hotel. The major compliant is the air conditioning in the rooms.  Rooms will not cool - very warm sleeping conditions.   The A/C shuts off when you open the door.  Beds are very hard.  The food and entertainment was amazing.   I would have given a 5 star rating if it wasn’t for the AC.

This resort is so laid back.  The food is always plentiful and good. There is nightly entertainment that is if the sun doesn't wear you out. Iberostar is our go-to for relaxation on the island. Having the dive shop right there makes it very convenient, but you may be diving with 24 of your best friends.

The facilities are well maintained and clean. The biggest attraction is the loose animals roaming around the hotel. Lovely! The dining options are great. 4/5 nights for a couple is ideal. The drinks at the pool bar are very sweet. The yoga and Pilates classes with Manolo are also great to start the day.

TripAdvisor Review for Cris   Went scuba diving with Cris from Peru @Iberostar Cozumel Scuba Trips. Iberostar has many snorkel and scuba trips right out of the resort with their own boats. Easy to book day of arrival and so convenient, the reefs were right next to the resort. Cris is an amazing instructor/guide. The crew and staff are all 5⭐️ at this all inclusive Iberostar Hotel. All 4 of us were never ever’s scuba people. We took advantage of their free scuba pool trial at 10:30am. Cris was precise in her delivery, competent, charming and beautiful. Cris’s expertise was obvious from the outset, turns out she is a marine biologist. The boat trip was hassle free, no waste of precious vacation time, with two 45 minute beginner scuba dives in the 3 hour adventure. We went 40- 45ft

We spent a week here with our 3 children. The place is soo beautiful , all the nature and animals around is very relaxing. The bedrooms were very nice . We loved the pools not crowded, able to find a longer each time , the beach was nice. We were not able to swim from the beach but from the dock because of seaweed. The staff was super super nice, helpful, smiling  Our little girl did some activities at the kid club, thanks to Montserrat, Ismael and Rosa she had great time! I would suggest to walk around the pools or beach before starting an activity to have more participants, as well as having a “teen group” with some more challenging activities: discover diving, discover bow and arrow, beach volley games, as the kid club is only until 12 years old. My husband went scuba diving

The activity staff Daniela, Julian and Fabian were amazing! The swim pool bartender Adrian’s was super kind and help us to know were to go. All the was good and was delicious. I love the activities and water aerobics and also all the shows  All the natural setting with the peacocks, coati, parrots and flamingo.

Exceptional service and attention to details. Everyone is doing their best to make your stay the best ever. That being said, I really want to thanks Pamela from dressel divers who went above and beyond to accommodate my diving schedule, Rodrigo the divemaster always smiling and very patient with my son’s first dive, and Fidel with his amazing skill of making the flaming mexican cocktail!

The grounds are very well maintained.  The flamingos, peacocks and thatched roofed buildings really add to the ambience.  Excellent staff, very friendly.  Before arriving, we were worried about the sargassum seaweed problem many Caribbean resorts are facing.  As this resort is on the western side of Cozumel, seaweed was not a problem.  There was a small amount along the shoreline one morning but staff had it cleared away quickly.  Some people have had negative comments on the condition of the wharf but I'm pleased to say that repair work was underway during our stay.  Overall, a good choice for a week in Cozumel.

Daniella, Donovan, Louis, and Fadian they were so amazing!! They were so friendly and filled with so much energy and so much fun to be around! Everything here was so beautiful clean and super nice! All of the food was amazing and so much fun trying new things!! Also the entertainment at night was amazing all of the performers were great!!

As usual, Iberostar Cozumel made our stay our best and most favorite place to be when away from home. Cindy is the absolute best server to have at breakfast and her smile is infectious. My children took a liking to Wilbert, and looked forward to having him each day. And I swear the food has improved since Orlando C. has been working in the kitchens! He takes pride in his job and wants to make people happy with what he cooks and serves everyday. And Rogelio... he is like family to us now as well. Everyone single person on staff there is happy, helpful, and some of the kindest people we have ever encountered on vacation. And let's not forget the folks at Dressel Divers! Eva, Milly, Pamela, Flo, Lucas, Ninha, and Julen is who we had taking care of us all last week. We miss you when

Great Resort with Dive shop directly on the resort. There therefore is a mix of divers and people just enjoying the all inclusive hotel. Kids club was also very friendly for our kids. They offered fun activities and our girls felt very comfortable with them.  Thanks Rosa and Montse!! Manolo from the gym actually is a physiotherapist and he made a great plan to help me with my back. Great holiday! Thanks for the good stay.

We just returned from a 4 night 5 day vacation with our 5 year old and 65+ parents. This resort had something for everyone. The pool and beaches were beautiful, the activities were fun and the food was good. The wild life was amazing, so many different species!   The rooms were our least favorite part as they were fairly small and very hard to keep cool. The good news was we do not spend a lot of time in the rooms as there was so much to do that when you came to the room it was just to sleep.   Our 5 year old loved Star Camp and begged to go every day. Rosa and Monserrat were attentive, positive and really interacted with the kiddos. They had many fun activities from making pizza, pool time, Tie-dye shirts and nature walks he couldn’t get enough!   My mother in law loved the

I played bingo with Daniela, it was so fun! I love the huts and it’s a whole different world here at Iberostar! Luis and Fabian were excellent at the swim up bar, and the resort is so clean. Our rooms were nice and clean when we came back from the pool and ocean.

Wonderful all inclusive resort. Outstanding, beautiful tropical grounds, gorgeous beach and pools. The  opposite of massive, concrete tourist hotels. Great architecture ! (Africa meets Carribean vibe) with well designed, first rate accommodations. Food was good, plenty to choose from. Service all around excellent. Highly recommend this resort.

Not a good experience. Would not recommend, would not return. Buffet food was bad. You have to eat there, cause you can only go to the restaurants once every 3 days. The bar only serves you well drinks and the bartenders make terrible drinks (my sangria was all sour mix with a splash of wine). Their are tons of stupid and frustrating rules... You can only get one beach towel and if you loose it or leave it by the pool it's 25$ ... Their is no service at the beach or pool chairs. Oh also the power kept going out in our room along with the AC - they moved us to another room after but offered us nothing in terms of compensation. Oh also the late night karaoke and pool side games are annoying as hell, we want to relax not hear people yell/sing to a cover of Journey.

We have been to this Iberostar ten time now.  We go for the diving in Cozumel.  This time was our first horrible experience with the property.  It started when on the first night we were there they experienced power fluctuations though out the night.  They said this caused issues with the air-conditions and none of them worked though out the resort.  We traveled with a large group of 35 people and 1/3 of them experienced no A/C for the week.  Our issue was a little worse then that as we had paid for an upgraded room close to the dive shop in building 22.  Not a big spend but it was $47 per night.  Our power never fully returned.  It would only stay on for two minutes at a time and you would have to get up and open the door to to restore power.  We asked for maintenance for many

I expected the trip to be good but it was better than I anticipated. My wife and I went with our son and his family. I am very particular about my diet and I wanted to maintain an exercise routine while there.  I had wonderful conversations with Manolo in the fitness center and he was incredibly helpful with adjusting my exercise routine.  I was very impressed and inspired by him. I along with family members tried his exercise classes and we really enjoyed them.  The swimming was the greatest swimming experience I have ever had. I wore simple swim goggles and could observe sea life as I swam along the buoy line in the ocean. So much space you didn't have to worry about others in your way.  There weren't enough snorkels to rent so I would recommend you take your own. I don't

Iberostar Cozumel did not disappoint!  We traveled for a week to Iberostar for our second trip to Cozumel with another family.    We reserved a family, two bedroom suite.  We completed online check in the day prior to arrival.  I believe this may be a new feature as they advertised that we would just be able to pick up our keys and start our vacation.  We had to complete what we feel was a normal check in.  The desk staff were pleasant and welcoming, as were the luggage attendants.    Our room was two standard rooms with an adjoining door.  We really enjoyed our keys being our wristbands.  It was so convenient throughout our stay.  We would recommend that the resorts system be updated for the family rooms that wristbands of parents work on the entry doors to both rooms.  Rooms

I am currently staying at the Iberostar with my partner and am loving it! The room is lovely, the pool area is large and full of entertainment, and the beach is top notch. Shout out to Manolo who taught a sunset yoga class earlier this week. It was awesome! I loved that he was able to differentiate his instruction for me, (a more advanced practitioner), and for my wife, (still a newbie yogi). Oh! And loved seeing the coatis, parrots, peacocks, flamingos, and iguanas! We would definitely stay again!

We visited early May 2023.   We have been to the resort multiple times previously.   Thus, concentrating on changes.   Smokehouse was very good - note that this is served family style - no ordering from a menu.   The games / activities / entertainment in the lobby before and after the nightly show was fun - enjoyable.   These activities after the show were appreciated, as the resort somewhat went dead after show in the past.   Loved the live music at the pooi - again, a welcomed improvement.   Danny - amazing singer!!   Resort - as always - very clean - landscaping is so enjoyable.  A very laid back resort - if you are wanting room service etc - not your kind of resort.   If you love meeting new people, seeing beautiful scenery as you walk, and encountering animals - your kind

Our fifth stay at Iberostar Cozumel was great!  Even though it had been a few years since our last visit, they had our family on their Welcome Back board in the lobby entrance which was a nice touch.  The staff at the resort is simply fantastic!  We recognized several staff members and some remembered us as well, which was really fun.  The food was good; everyone always found plenty to enjoy.  A special shout out to Cyndy and Fidel who made our return extra nice!  We were always comfortable.  I'd like to share a very special thank you to Laura, who helped us with a lost or stolen passport.  I don't know how much time she spent doing all she could to assist us, but it was one of the most impressive displays of service I've ever encountered! Laura, you are a tremendous asset to
Daniella, fabion, Louise, Donovan, Francisco, and Guadalupe really made our trip! Great staff at this resort would recommend!  The food and drinks were good  The rooms comfortable and also the bed😁😁😁

We stayed at Iberostar Cozumel last week and the stay was fantastic. My family of 4 (2 kids) were part of a larger family group of 10. All of the restaurants were able to accommodate us. Diving with Dressel divers was a breeze having them right there on site.  My family of 4 stayed in a family room which was clean and well kept. We enjoyed our visit and felt completely relaxed. We appreciate all of the staff's hard work around the resort, every person we saw was working hard.   A special shout out to those who helped us celebrate my daughters birthday, and to the staff working Star Camp. We did not know much about Star Camp until we arrived - Rosa, Ismael, and Montse at Star Camp made my daughters week! Rosa, Ismael, and Montse were so patient, kind, and creative keeping the

We had a great time at Iberostar Cozumel.  Situated right at some of the best diving, Iberostar did not disappoint.  The entertainment crew was a surprise. We thoroughly enjoyed all of the activities, water aerobics, volley ball, pictionary and beach yoga.  Daniella, Fabian, Donavan and Louis worked hard for us and were fun and engaging.  I wish I could remember the yoga instructors name because his class was one of the best I have taken.  Our rooms were clean and nice and food was great.

We have stayed at high-end resorts and inexpensive ones here in Cozumel over the last six year, but the Iberostar is the only place we'll stay from here on out.    Unlike some other resorts in Cozumel, our check in took a total of ten minutes.  We were given a quick golf cart tour of the resort's layout and escorted to our room.  The room was smallish, but had everything you would want. There was a fridge with Coke, Diet Coke, Sprite, and Dos Equis.  It was restocked each day.  The A/C was incredible for the tropics.  The shower water pressure and temperature were spot on, which isn't always the case. The wristband key was a real nice tough also.   Unlike other resorts, you don't have to get up at 6 a.m. to reserve a place at the beach.  Each day we got down to the beach about

Very friendly people in the hotel, excellent food, and excellent stay, Manolo from the gym, was very kind and helpful, his attention and knowledge is excellent, he always keeps the gym in a perfect condition.

Beautiful resort where you feel like your living in a jungle. There are native animals that freely roam around and a gorgeous beach view.   The food was very good and there were plenty of meal options for everyone. Very friendly and accommodating staff. If you go to the Mexican restaurant and like tequila, I highly recommend arranging a tequila tasting with Fidel. He is very fun and can enhance the dining experience! Jonathan at the grill also offers great service.  There are so many awesome things you can do on the island, but there is plenty to do without having to leave the resort as well! Take advantage of all the free shows and games run by the entertainment staff!  A couple things to note:   -The mosquitos were out so be sure to pack bug spray. -The beach was rocky near

Great hotel! Right on the beach and extremely beautiful. The biggest highlight is the service at all the restaurants. Everyone was so thoughtful and accommodating. The food was great and I felt very well taken care of. Extra thanks to Atocha, who was our waiter for many days and was so friendly even just in passing. Great hotel. Service was very good. Food was fantastic, with massive portions expertly prepared and served. Beach small but lovely. Snorkeling off the beach was amazing. Well located, not far from town, taxis on the door, few spaces for parking if you rented a car (as me), all rooms overlooking the sea, nice beach directly outside the building, nice pool, many water activities organized in the hotel. Breakfast and food ok and also over the water which is very nice to see,  all clear transparent, turquoise. Rooms well kept and cleaned. We traveled with friends and children ages 8-11 and I would recommend this hotel!  The hotel is very clean and the location was great. The Westin is on the north west side of the island.  The property is beautiful and pristine. For a property of this nature, not having enough seating  and towels for guests is not reasonable. Beach side wait servers were few and far between.  Snorkel gear is old and beat up. Safety jackets need to be replaced to be truly safe.  Buffet breakfast is plentiful but the food is less than mediocre. Platinum and above Marriott members are comped. The dining room  is quite pleasant and outside seating for breakfast and lunch is a treat.  Our junior suite was on the third floor with a jacuzzi tub

Our stay at The Westin Cozumel was just amazing. The room was beautiful as the hotel is quite new, and the view is breathtaking.  The service at the Restaurant Gaviotas was just phenomenal; the staff there is just very welcoming, pleasant and always making sure we were all set and served properly. I would like to recognize the team that served us during that week: Margarita, Marco, Erbe, Lulu, Danela, Jorge and Miguel. Thank you to all of you for an amazing vacation. We will be back!

The hotel is beautiful and the pools are great. All the staff is very helpful. The rooms are luxurious and the views are amazing! Thanks for taking such good care of me for Breakfast and Dinner every day of my stay!

Per couple per day

We had the absolute best time at the Westin! We could not recommend more. We didn’t want for anything and the staff was not only lovely, but I feel like we genuinely are friends. Angel took care of us multiple times at dinner and is attentive, friendly, and simply just the best. Jorge at the roof top bar is a star and we had the best time. I would say come for the view, location, service, but stay for the people. We will be back to the Westin the next time we visit Cozumel and we cannot wait to see our amigos Angel and Jorge.

We had a fantastic time at Westin Cozumel. Angel provided phenomenal service, and my wife and I cannot wait to return. They have every amenity you could want. We very much enjoyed our time here and would recommend it to any couple visiting Cozumel.

We had a great time at the pool. Especially with the exceptional service of MARCO. He made sure we were well taken care of while visiting the pool beach area. He made sure we had food, drinks and towels. Always checked on us. Excellent pool experience

I was very excited to see same people we met last year. Thank you looking forward to coming back.

Nice facilities and the food in both restaurants and the pool snack shack was excellent.  Good service all around.  Very comfortable rooms. Only deductions are for (1) shortage of umbrellas with the beach loungers, and (2) A/C in our room couldn't keep up with the heat, so our room was only "cool" between about midnight and 800 AM.

While my framily had a great time at this property, our dinner experience would make us come back to check in with him and see how he’s doing.

The staff are super friendly. The rooms are very clean and the beds are the softest on the island. Juan Marcos and the rest of the guys at the pool and Margarita at the Kids Club were key in making our stay fantastic.

Beautiful views, clean and comfortable accomodations, friendly and helpful staff,  amazing snorkeling off the beach. Javier was our gracious host and went the extra mile to ensure our stay was unforgettable.

Jorge took good care of us. House cleaning did a good job and was responsive. Adult pool was not heated and quite chilly. Buffet food was very good and many healthy choices. Paid extra for dinner on the beach, soup and salad were outstanding, the main course was less than average. We are planning our next trip to Cozumel and will consider Meliá, but it’s not the slam dunk I hoped it would be.

Willian has been there 21 years and is so friendly. Hector a greeter is so AMAZING and friendly. Activity people were so fun. Everyone was just so happy!!! The ocean is very clear, but yes, is clearer on the other side. Highly recommend this place. Perfect for families or if you are looking for a more relaxing atmosphere.

Low quality and variety of food. Only 2 kind of beers available (same brand). Wifi constantly disconnecting. Limited information about all services available. Staff admitted that this property is different (not very good) than other Melia properties. NOT REALLY personalised service and the most exclusive products in privileged areas of the hotel for The Level.

Everything was so amazing here ! Definitely would come back, the service and food was amazing. The staff is very welcoming and inviting as well as accommodating. We had a wonderful peaceful stay, and enjoyed every minute.

Great place, staff was so good and they work so hard. Beach was excellent, food was great.  Drinks are a little watered down, or alcohol to drink ratio made it taste very light.  Internet is hit and miss.  Reasonably priced. Not overly populated, but busy enough that you could make friends easy.

The vacation was absolutely amazing. The hotel is very clean and beautiful. The beach is amazing with very soft sand. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel like family. Mary, Jacob, Leo, and Oswaldo made the daily activities so much fun, they are the absolute best entertainment team ever!!!

Beautiful beach with lots of seating options and hard working, friendly staff! Buffet and restaurants were delicious with a variety of choices. Nice, clean rooms and well maintained grounds. A great experience for our first time to Cozumel!

The staff is nothing short of AMAZING. Very kind, and helpful. We wished we would have been shown around the facility a little before going to our room.. we just had to find everything on our own. Also we didn't know about earing breakfast in the Fish house until our last 2 mornings.. so that was a disappointment that we missed out the first part of our vacation.

Next-door resort offers amazing snorkeling (horrible beach though). We just walked to next door resort couple times when we felt like snorkeling.

From the moment we stepped on to the property until we checked out five days later, the service and staff were outstanding.  Everyone was so freindly and accommodating.  If I ever have the opportunity to return to Cozumel, "Melia Cozumel" would be the my first choice for a all-inclusive resort stay. Fantastic!

We had a couples massage at the YHI Spa at Melia with Teresita and Angelica who were both great at what they do. Can opt for on the beach or in the spa. A fantastic and relaxing experience that you don’t realize you needed until afterwards.

Beach was awesome, huge sandy, shallow swim area, rare for Cozumel. Walked a short distance down the beach to next resort where the snorkelling was quite good, walk right in off beach. Thanks Melia staff you were great. If I was they type of person to do the same thing again I could see coming here more times.

Humberto, Enrique, Santiago - all awesome and made our stay great. Would definitely return.

What a quiet and peaceful adventure for us. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food services were great. The pool bar was awesome. The facilities were kept clean. Any requests we made were met. We will be coming back.

Lucio offered us amazing service, at the buffet. He and his staff are amazing!!! Miguel was an amazing server, always asking if we needed anything, and refilling our drinks right on time. The coffee was amazing and everyday the menu was something different and amazing.

Jorge, Francisco,Freddie and Christian gave us the best service at the Mexican restaurant on the beach. The food was amazing, they were very tentative and made us feel like we were Royalty. It was worth the trip just to be served by these amazing gentlemen.

We had a great trip staying in a Level Royal Suite. Great service and accommodations. The beach was very well kept and it was so nice being in a less populated part of the island. Loved eating at Mole at night and the buffet were our favorite food options. The Michael Jackson tribute show was fantastic for its opening night.  Highly recommend.

I am partial to this resort because they do everything well and they make sure that your trip is enjoyable. The entire Melia team led by Sandra, Carlos and Erik go above and beyond their duties and it is greatly appreciated. My wife and I have not only found a place to call home but also a place that really treats you like family.

Ruebel was an amazing server and had the best customer service I've seen in a while. Was prompt in his services and waited on My family daily. He remembered names, drinks, favorite food items etc. Wish him the best 👌🏽.

My husband and I throughly enjoyed our weeks stay at Melia Cozumel. The resort is very clean. We loved relaxing and the views were beautiful! The beach is absolutely breathtaking. We cannot wait to go back.

A wonderful place, with very helpful and friendly staff. Restaurants were excellent ! Service was superior ! The excursions that we bought into, were not as good as we expected, in fact they were terrible ( 4 wheelers riding thru the jungle and snooba diving .)... But, to be very clear, the resort and its employees were wonderful !!!

Gonna go ahead and leave a review for those still trying to decide on what resort to stay at... Melia was nice, has a little bit of a more upscale feel than some, and we just stayed in the regular part, we did not level up. The rooms are very cool thank God cause it was a welcome relief from the June heat! Beds are a little hard, but not bad and lots of pillows! Good sized and the bathroom was fine but be careful of those slippery tubs!! Nearly biffed it a couple times!! They should really put something in them for safety! The bath towels are huge! But only 2 wash cloths and half the days room service didn't even bring new ones?!? I brought disposable which was very handy for face washing and showering. Took a while but we finally figured out how to get the TV to English, you

This was our first time at this resort and a Melia resort. It was fantastic! The beach was amazing in and out of the water. It was like you had your own private resort. There were always plenty of chairs, cabanas, and towels. There were no time share people and the service was just perfect. The rooms were made up everyday and the mini bar was stocked every day. The food was also very tasty for the value. We loved the variety of the buffet and different items were on the grill for the meals. The food was made in small portions and  were in pan sizes, so everything was always fresh and hot. This was my first time writing a review. We like staying at different resorts, but I can say we will be back to this one!

My 8 year old boy had the best time ever, he was kept busy with a variety of activities by a great staff Susy was great! We enjoyed the relaxing time not being worried about keeping him busy. The food was good the drinks were good, and we went early June when there was not a big crowd.

My wife and I visited the YHI spa for a massage and mini facial. We were taken care of by Gloria and Teresita. The massage was the very professional as well as relaxing. We were also given 2 very nice bags compliments of the spa.  We both commented on how well we slept that evening after the massage. I would highly recommend a spa treatment while staying at the Melia in Cozumel.  You will not be disappointed!!

Friendly staff and beautiful resort to visit. Laid back  15 min from airport using Cozushuttle no hassle from timeshare people. Food and beverage was average for all inclusive. Enjoyed are stay, this was are second time back to this resort.

The resort is very clean.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Hector will make sure you get to where you want to be supplying fast outside service.  Philippe is an amazing bartender at the pool bar.  Leveling up was definitely worth the cost.

This is a small resort compared to others where I’ve stayed. There’s a pool for adults and another for children. Given that we “leveled up” and didn’t have small children with us, we stayed on the adult side. Rooms were nice and service was excellent. (Felipe at the bar deserves many prizes for service and tolerance.)   This resort is also tamer than others I’ve visited. No loud music, parties, or activities at the adult pool. It’s very chill, with an older crowd and families.   The food options are just ok. Three restaurants—Mediterranean, Fish House, and Mexican- plus the buffet.   The beach is lovely, the resort clean, the service excellent, and the food ok. If you’re looking for a smaller, quieter resort, this is a great option.

Property as a whole: This hotel is not gated at all. Usually when I book an all-inclusive resort, I expect a gated entrance as a bit more of protection as I am traveling in another country. Some hotels in Cozumel have that large gate. This one does not. It is closer to civilization and is not as secluded. Also, expect alot of stairs and ramps when staying at this property. When it rains, this gets dangerous very quickly.   Food: The food is just ok and the buffet is at least located indoors away from most insects. If you are on a vegan diet, then the buffet is where it is at for you. You will always have fresh fruit, sautéed vegetables, and potatoes there. There is also an omlette bar and a tostada station at breakfast. The french fries are obviously frozen fries and they aren't

We had an amazing time! All the staff were great. Room was great resort is so clean! Only thing they should do different is parties with children should have a cut off time for dinner reservations.  The entrainment stuff really did an awesome job !!!!

We traveled with our friends for a parent’s getaway—4 couples in all. Beautiful resort, serene beaches, excellent service, delicious food, and the best pool bartender, Willian! We had an exceptional vacation and absolutely will be returning!!

We very much enjoyed our stay.  The resort is very well kept and service is top notch.  A special thanks to Gabriel (our concierge), Willian at the pool bar,  and Jorge our server in la isla at breakfast and dinner time.

Adrian, David and Humberto hosted us at the Mole oceanfront restaurant on Father's Day. Excellent, friendly service and a delicious meal. We really enjoyed the lime soup, grilled shrimp and cheesecake!

Rooms are dated with stained sheets and towels. Awful food selection and options. Beverage of poor quality disguised in name brand bottles and not too many options for drinks. Staff is nice but quality of hotel and amenities is 0 stars. Would not stay again. Also beware of mosquito infestation.

Loved the overall resort. Loved the concierge Jorge, he checked on us the whole time. He was quick to take care of any issues we had. The pool and beach bartenders, Felipe and Willian were fantastic and super friendly. The food was okay in variety and flavor. The Mole restaurant had great Sea Bass and Beef Tacos but the open air restaurant had a ton of mosquito's. The Royale level suite was clean and on the bathroom was on the small side. However if you choose this room for the semi private outside jacuzzi it is virtually unusable as the mosquitos will eat you alive. The main reason we upgraded to that room and did not get to take advantage. That was pretty much the only negative. The Level part was definitely worth it though. We loved the slower atmosphere and adult only level

Service was great! We had a wonderful time here at the Meliã Cozumel. Very family friendly and had lots of things to keep us busy. They had ping pong, tennis, basketball, pickleball, etc. They had many tabletop games also. The level service was incredible. We had workers walk around the level section on the beach and ask us if we want any drinks and they would come back with all the drinks you asked for. Great community! The fish house was amazing. Francisco, Jorge, Fredy, and Christian made our dinner so much better! They had great attitudes and always had a smile on their faces. They were very polite and kind.

We stayed at Melia Cozumel for our anniversary and had such a wonderful week! I do recommend upgrading to The Level. We received exceptional service, and we enjoyed leisurely breakfasts at The Fish House on days that we weren't in a hurry. The buffet food is fine and is especially good at breakfast, which is great if you are in a hurry.   The spa is incredible, and the prices are totally reasonable considering that the prices are for couples.  We really enjoyed our dinners at the Mole restaurant. Do make sure that you go ahead and use the available bug spray since it's an open air restaurant. The food was delicious at the end of the day.   Everyone is just so, so nice and goes out of their way to treat you well. We especially enjoyed talking with Hector, who called most of our

No waiters at the beach or kids pool area, rooms and furniture with no maintenance , kids pool from the 1980's and the play area very updated , the power went out for two days for more than 3 hours with no a/c anywhere in or out

Greta trip to Melia Cozumel.  Jorge was  amazing - he set up reservations for dinner and Bali beds on the beach! He was very responsive and friendly. Beach service was also amazing -very attentive  The only negative was there was not enough umbrellas or covered areas on the beach if you couldn’t reserve a Bali bed you were out in the direct sun- plenty of chairs but no cover  Thank you for a grey trip!

Above Average - My only issues were that the WiFi was weak the first couple of days, but unfortunately there was no service the last two days we were there. The other reason is the pool bar which is only for adults (18+) shuts down at 6pm. I believe that is way to early to shut down an adult swim up bar.

Perfect for families wanting to relax without breaking the bank. Susy from the Kids club was amazing! The Fish House restaurant has delicious food and attentive service. The capitan customer's service is outstanding (can't remember his name to save my life) he was so kind and personalized. He surprised us with a cake to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This was the highlight of our trip.

This hotel made my vacation one of the best vacations of my life. Not only was the hotel, very organized and clean but the people that work there were so sweet, fun, and very caring. They were always there to provide service if you needed any. Where the buffet is, the waiters are so sweet and always there for what you need.  One of my favorite parts of the vacation was the activities they had throughout today. The people that ran the activities names were April, David, and Leo. April, David, and Leo were so fun to be around and made every activity worth it. Such things like the volleyball, and Zumba were one of my favorites. April, David, and Leo would always hype everybody up and make us feel good about ourselves. Also, the kids club looked very fun and the person running. The

The overall resort is okay. The rooms were clean and the food was good. The beach is nice.  However, they don't have drink service out in the beach, unless you upgrade, which they tried repeatedly when I was checking in. The general staff is not rude, but not very friendly either. The waiters/waitresses are nice. Room service doesn't start until 7 am so you cannot get coffee to your room for sunrise watching. In-roof coffee maker and coffee were not good. The TV in the bedroom did not work, I called to request maintenance and the personnel never showed up. The books in the gift shop are mispriced. Amazing. Best resort on the island. Tons to do, the nicest staff, lots of activities and shows, wonderful pools and great food. Best resort we’ve found for kids! Rooms and clean and big. We’ve stayed 4 times and love it!

The service here is still excellent. Everyone who works here is simply lovely. The food is good and the location is great.   Unfortunately, we will never come back. This place is absolutely overrun with children of all ages. There aren’t enough pool chairs to accommodate guests, and the pool is basically a middle school gym class at this point. The kids use the restaurants and bars as if they were adults, consuming as much sugar as humanly possible. I guess this is what happens when kids 17 and under are free.   I never felt the need to do an adults-only resort because the occasional family is no big deal. But after quite a mediocre vacation in such a beautiful place with amazing service, it seems like my hand is forced.

First time at Cozumel and very little disappointed us. In fact, probably just the fact that the resort is in need of a facelift. Everything else was perfect.  We'd been told ahead of time that the staff is what makes Cozumel so special, and it is 100% true.  Our Diamond Concierges Nina and David (at the pool) exceeded our expectations; we could not ask for better attention.  We're low-key pool people (day-drinking is a distant image in our rear-view mirror!) but whenever we did need anything Jossie, Alan, Gabriel, Jairo and Jorge were always right there.  Breakfast and lunch were always highlighted by the attention of Heri, Enrique, Marco, Calos, Julio, Fili and Sarahy.  All were great but if we were to single one out it would be Heri. He is a tremendous asset to Palace.  Martha

What a gorgeous room with a view of the ocean!  I didn’t know we’d have an in-room jacuzzi with robes and slippers.  Too bad we were traveling as a family and had to wear swimsuits when trying it out.  The hammock on our balcony was perfect for relaxing after overeating from the delicious buffet.  It was really a treat having a bottle of wine waiting for us and a mini fridge that was restocked daily. The kids particularly enjoyed being able to order virgin mixed drinks from the bar and of course they liked the sweet shop. Speaking of which, The nightly chocolates  was a nice touch. I really enjoyed my stay at the Cozumel Palace. The activity staff Suny, David, and Moises were all super friendly and nice. We went paddleboarding and kayaking with them. They also provided us with volleyball and spikeball. They made our stay very enjoyable even when the day was rainy and we couldn’t go outside, they were happy and found activities for all of us indoors.

Get Vanessa for your scuba discovery and any scuba trips! She rocks! The staff is amazing here, and they really take care of you! Entertainment was great, food was awesome, and all-inclusive makes it very easy to relax!

I stayed here this week, Suny really helped my family and I with the paddleboarding, and I felt like I was in a very safe and fun environment. She was great! As well Charlie and David and Luis who ran the activities were so funny and entertaining. I really enjoyed the 4:00 pm volleyball each day they all kept everyone engaged and made sure to include even the little kids.

Overall this was about what we expected from an all-inclusive in Mexico.  It was just average.  The food was average, not great but not terrible.  The room was in good shape, good air conditioning, clean, refrigerator with beers, soda, and water, also the liquor dispenser.  Coffee maker in room.  Their were two small bags of chips chips and some peanuts in the room the day we arrived but they were never refilled even after asking the front desk and calling to request the refill.    The biggest issue we had with the room was one day after being at the pool all day, we got off the elevator and smelled a varnish type smell.  It got stronger as we approached our room and when we opened the door to go in there was an intense odor of varnish that we could not stay in the room.  Called

We spent 9 days on excursions, snorkeling, relaxing, having cocktails and loving paradise. The following people made our stay amazing: Jairo - one of our waiters Martha whose smile never ends and gives the best hugs ever Reyes - one of our bartenders.  His smile never ends and always makes you feel special. Enrique - one of our bartenders Henri - One of our waiters David - by the pool.  Always made sure whatever we needed we had. Maria - the morning chef/cook - she can make anything and is amazing Isaacs - bellman - always helped us get where we needed to go.  He is amazing. Abraham - bellman - another who helped us get where we needed to go.  He is also amazing. Johnny - outside at dinner - greeted us and made us feel so special. Charlie - entertainment - kept us entertained

I just want to get information about packages the resort offering while I am in Cozumel for my next vacation but could not get in.  A security person keep saying “inclusive” and another person not sure what his duty is  just rudely ask “what package you want”. Not sure how the sales and marketing work here but staff does not seem to be customer friendly. Do I have to blindly book through some travel agencies without seeing it while I am there?

We have been eying the hotel for a few years. We are regular cozumel visitors. This was the best hotel we have stayed at  so far.   Staff made me give 5 stars. Very friendly and helpful if you tip or not. Clean with masks everywhere.   Food was delicious. Room service was over out expectations.  Hotel is old yes. Needs some remodeling yes. But spotless clean.   I recommend the hotel with great confidence.

We loved our time at Cozumel Palace! It's a perfect spot for a couple's vacation--not too big but not too small; amazing hospitality and service; gorgeous views; delicious food and drinks; fun activities and entertainment; convenient location to airport and excursions. We will be back!

This resort had amazing hospitality, awesome food, a gorgeous atmosphere and a very comfortable room for our family.  We snorkled every day right off our resort, walked to the downtown area, and were a block away from swimming with dolphins.   I would highly recommend this resort!

We booked very, very late, so our choices were few, unless we were willing to move resorts mid-vacation (no!). I had heard the food was decent at this resort and the snorkeling was good, so of our 4 choices we figured we'd give the Palace a shot. Small resort with excellent service and didn't feel crowded, even though it was completely booked. The loft suite was great for us and our 2 teens. Careful if you have tall teens though - 6 feet is the maximum for the upper level - the ceiling is low. Snorkelling off the front of the resort is great - we brought our own gear and it was a daily activity for us. Lots to see in this area! The service really is what sets them apart. Rocio and Carmen at Bugambilias were just so wonderful. Sarahy and Marco at Turquesa - and a special nod to Angel. I had asked about a specific breakfast item that wasn't available every day. First, I would like to be clear that we had a wonderful time at the actual Cozumel Palace. The service was incredible and the location was amazing. However, we cannot give more than 1-star bc of the high pressure and misleading sales pressure to become Palace Elite members. After agreeing to attend a 90 min presentation, we ended up becoming members. We were told we would receive 20-30% off rates compared to any website or through any third party. We were pressured to buy membership at a level that would allow us to book family suites at the discounted rate. However, as soon as we got home, I tried to look at booking a week in the loft suite at Cozumel Palace and the price was actually slightly higher on the “member-only” preferential rate website than I could get on hotels.com.

We were there May 2022 & Sept 2021. Both times there have been wonderful employees helping us outside their job of wait staff or spa attendant etc. We have been helped walking and shopping. They remember names and are so nice. The food is wonderful too. I really enjoy the snorkling right out th back door.

It was wonderful from the time we arrived to the day we departed. The service in all areas was just great including Room Service. Being there during Carnaval was an extra bonus. The Chef's Dinner was not to be missed.
Awesome trip!! David in entertainment was the best!! Great food and lots to do!! Super nice rooms,  great drinks, very clean!! Wonderful service overall and the employees are so kind and hardworking!

David the entertainment guy was so intentional and remembered our names and got everyone involved at the pool! He was energetic and did such fun games! He was a highlight of the trip with my friends! Will definitely come back.

From the moment you arrive the Bellmen of Isaias, Pascaul, Abraham and Manuel welcome you with a big smile and welcome home. This is our 12th year coming to Cozumel Palace and each year is great. The front desk under the direction of Ana Gomez are all like family. Joel and Zarah always helped us with a great room, change for tips, big smiles and a occasional hug.  The clean up crews make your room sparkle every day.  Once we got outside the Activity staff had big hugs and welcomes and challenges on the ping pong table, at the pool and in the ocean. Rodrigo gave me a big challenge in the workout room along with Louis. Charlie, Zarah, David and Moises took on the paddle board and ping pong challenge. Suni, Dianne and manager Abi made everyone feel special. We had great help from

We won't stay anywhere else when we travel to Cozumel.  This hotel has become our Mexico get away.  The hotel itself is beautiful, comfortable and so clean.  The entire staff are professional, friendly and provide service incomparable to any other hotel.  The restaurants are very good and offer a wide variety of different cuisines to try.  And for us, most importantly,  the scuba diving experience with Aqua Safari is outstanding.

Great view. Wonderful staff and spa.  Gorgeous view of the ocean. The food was very good. Was close enough to walk into town for other restaurants and activities. They made arrangements for snorkeling catamaran tour. Would  go back again.  Great time.

First time going to Cozumel and fourth time visiting a Palace resort. The resort is small but what it lacks in size it makes up for with awesome service! Every staff member happily helped make your stay comfortable. We never were without a drink in hand. Gabriel was by far the best server we have had at any all inclusive resort! He would seek us out and always go above and beyond. He even got my daughter a salad that wasn’t listed on the pool menu when she asked. It was very busy as we traveled during peak season but he always made sure we had what we needed and then some.  I should also mention that the food was delicious! We especially enjoyed Momo and the Italian restaurant. This was our first time taking advantage of the on-site photographer. Tania was amazing! Check out

Everything was absolutely perfect. Wish there was a regular beach. And the towels need to be softer as when you’re sunburned they are pretty rough. George from the pool area. Every day was wonderful very hard hard worker, and Jose flamingo from the Buffay on patio to all the employees. They were absolutely wonderful even the girls daily at the breakfast buffet entrance they could not do enough for you.

Great service & property, as usual Palace staff make you feel right at home. The staff treat you like family members, from the pool (David having your chairs & umbrella ready every day) to the restaurants (Bryan, Juan, Heol). The coffee shop staff make the best coffee along with the snacks. The spa is top notch.

Terrible pillows..  It’s just OLD, Old, old. Needs tons of maintenance and updating. Same pool tiles were still missing 9 YEARS LATER! They took away the pretty bars stools! 😖 And THEN, they closed off 1/3 of the pool seating to refinish the concrete IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DAY.  They don’t enforce their own POLICIES! Guest went out to the pool before sunrise to claim a lounge chair and then they wouldn’t show up until afternoon! The management allowed it even though they claimed your things would be moved after an hour. Bar kept running out of champagne! Then they turned us away at the Italian restaurant when they clearly had seating. 😡

My husband and I just had a wonderful time at the Cozumel Palace. Staff and guests are so friendly. It was just the two of us, but we made friends every time we went to the pool. The pool is very nice with 2 levels and warm water! I booked the Cozumel Palace because of the view from our room, a lot of the other resorts don't look like they have great views of the ocean from your room or the pool, Cozumel Palace has great views every where you look. Our room was very spacious, comfortable bed and great balcony. Would definitely go back!

We've been visiting this resort since before it became a Palace property and it always feels like home.  The staff greet us like family that hasn't seen each other in a while.  They all bend over backwards to meet every need and always with a smile and a casual "it's a pleasure"!  In terms of all inclusive properties the amenities available for a small sized hotel are awesome:  snorkeling, paddle boards, kayaks, ping-pong, board games, onsite dive shop, exercise room, swim up pool bar, daily pool activities including spin class, water aerobics, volleyball, coffee/desert bar with excellent cappuccino etc, in room jacuzzi (which we never use but must appeal to some), daily entertainment both during the day and evening including dance shows, singers, jazz music, piano sing along,

Resort was great, very clean. Staff were exceptional! My kids loved jumping of the dock and snorkeling ever day!  Restaurants were great not overcrowded never had to make a reservation or wait in line. Resort is about a 20 minute walk to downtown area my family enjoyed going downtown at night to shop or explore. We have stayed at the Moon Palace resort in Cancun previously. We loved the moon palace that resort is much bigger many more restaurants, I activities however, we felt this resort was nice because of its size. With having children, we would let them have a little more space and felt completely safe due to this resort being smaller we also were told to take the ferry one day and visit the Playa Del Carmen resort, which was nice to see a new resort, city pools and beach

We had a great time at the Palace. Every staff member was friendly, helpful and would do anything they could to make our stay more enjoyable. The food was excellent (far better than any other all-inclusive resorts we have experienced). The activities and spa services we signed up for were top notch. Do I recommend the hotel? Yes. Would I return? Probably not. The special privilege's afforded to certain levels of membership is not something I want to deal with on vacation. Our first night, we were unable to get a table at any of the a la carte restaurants. After escaping the snobbish, diamond preferred Playa del Carmen Palace we were treated like honored guests, the kind of service and concern that we have always been use to at other Palace resorts.  This is a very tiny resort but the people, activities and food are on par with a much larger resort.  There was plenty of room for all members regardless of wristband color.  The buffet at Turquesa was excellent and had a few new items that we didn't get at other Palace locations.  Had a great day. Thank you all.

All Staff was very good. The restaurant food was amazing!!! The 3 restaurants we went to:  Italian, Mexican and Breakfast’s  food exceeded our expectations. Only negatives—didn’t like the arrival and check out sales pitches to upgrade, buy a membership etc. And on main floor room was very noisy at night…the sound carrie’s from the bar/lobby.

If I based this review solely on the food and service, it would be five stars.  The food at this resort was amazing and the service is truly special.  Super friendly and professional staff.  But this resort is OLD and is majorly showing its age.  It needs a complete overhaul.  There were so many areas that were just gross.  I think they try hard to keep it clean, but once a building is that old, it's impossible to not have it look dingy.  Also, there was a constant sewage smell in certain areas that was horrible.  The pool/beach chairs were old and gross, as were the tables at the outside restaurant.  They need to invest some money into this resort to have the rooms and buildings keep up with the great food and service.

Amazing Staff and Service!  I can't wait to go back! I look forward to interacting with all of your amazing team...they truly know what customer service is supposed to be! They attended to our every need with a smile and genuine spirit...very professional and caring environment!

Staying at the Cozumel Palace was great.  My family of 4 and our group of 17 stayed for 1 week ( April 1st - 8th) and everyone had a good time.  I am going to evaluate my experience. Food- 4/5. The food was pretty good.  We liked Momo Asian restaurant best.  Antonio was the best server/ waiter on the resort.  He was very patient and professional. Room- 4/5 The room was nice however the jacuzzi is kinda wasted space unless you absolutely love jacuzzis.  Bathroom was good.  I would’ve preferred 2 queens instead of doubles. Decent view from floor 3 Gym-  2/5 Unfortunately the worst gym because of space and equipment.  Not much in there and a treadmill wasn’t working when we were there Drinks- 3/5 Drinks were kinda watered down.  I asked for a floater(extra shot) on most drinks.

We have just returned home from a great week spent at Cozumel Palace.   Hanna and Julio provided great service for breakfast at Flamingoes as did Ricardo at dinner in the Italian restaurant where the Caprese risotto is my new favorite!  By the pool, Jennifer, Perla, David and especially Jorge provided excellent lounge and lunch service. Javier made the most excellent “bumblebees” for us and ooh the chocolate martini! Everyone was great but no one provided hugs and a welcome like Martha and Salma at Bugambilia’s. We will miss them both!  The General Manager, Pamela, went out of her way to make sure we were well taken care of and amazingly remembered us from a visit to Sun Palace in 2012.
