Drive from airport only took 10 minutes or less and we received a warm welcome. They have staff that can help you book excursions/tours.  Very few resorts on Cozumel are adults only.  If you go in March/early April, expect there to be kids.  There weren’t many toddlers or small kids as the resort is geared more towards late elementary/jr high age.  Had entertainment at 8 and 9 PM each night.  We liked the earlier time as we’ve gone to some resorts where the entertainment doesn’t start until 9 or 9:30, which gets late.  We had room 116. We had no patio or balcony space so couldn’t sit right outside our room. If you like going to bed early or sleeping in late, recommend a room higher up. We were close to the lobby so noise didn't die down until between 11 and 12. Workers would

This was our second stay at Cozumel Palace and it was once again fabulous.  The food is delicious and the staff are so attentive and friendly.  Even though there is no beach that touches the surf, there is a quiet sandy area in front of the family suites that we spent many happy hours lounging at.  We also enjoyed the snorkeling right in front of the resort.    The addition of the coffee/sweet shop in the lobby is a nice addition!  On the way home, our flight was canceled and American Airlines put us up at another luxury all inclusive (Westin).  It was beautiful but definitely didn't have the welcoming feel of Cozumel Palace and the food wasn't nearly as good.

We have stayed at the Palace several times and it always is an enjoyable experience.  I love that a lot of the staff remember us from our past stays.  The location is amazing, we enjoying walking in to town while we are there and this is doable without getting a taxi.  The staff does everything to make sure your experience is the best that it can be.  Some people tip and some don't, but you will never notice a difference on how the staff treats each one.  The food is wonderful, the Italy restaurant is our favorite, but the food you can order around the pool is also very yummy.  Room service is outstanding, and very quick and easy to order.  And when it comes to cocktails, let me tell you we have stayed at resorts where I felt like the alcohol was watered down, not here.  They

We had the best time at Cozumel Palace. Probably the best staff we’ve ever encountered. Raul and Rodrigo at the pool bar were so great and accommodating.  Moises on the entertainment crew was excellent, even though he cheats at volleyball (😜).  Resort has beautiful views, clean rooms and attentive housekeeping staff. Overall amazing experience.

Nice hotel. Staff ALWAYS go above and beyond. Food was delicious! Coffee Bar is wonderful extra touch in lobby. Convenient Location to town. But we learned to stay away from town when the cruise ships are in port- chaos! Take a snorkeling trip that day or stay in the pool all day.

I can't imagine a more beautiful or welcoming place in all of Cozumel. Perched against the sparkling blue Caribbean Sea, the views are unbelievable.    The food!  Be prepared to expand your waistline!  We arrive late, but that was no problem.  All the restaurants were open.  We chose the Mexican restaurant our first night, which ended up being our favorite.  These staff there, Elizabeth, Victoria, and Martina were so warm and kind that we practically cried on our last night there. And the food was outstanding.  There are three other options which are also fantastic--Asian (which offers Chinese and Japanese dishes, alternating with Indian every other night or so) Italian and a more casual bar/snack option that also turns into a buffet some nights.  Every restaurant has special

We had an amazing time. Moises and Charlie with the entertainment group were super! The spa is small but the staff are fantastic. Maury, Yanett, Theresa - manager - there are more but these are the names I remember. The spa was one of my favorites because the staff is outstanding. Restaurants are amazing. Hannah greeted us most mornings at breakfast. The wait staff were on top of things; very helpful and friendly. The food this trip was some of the best we've had at all of the Palace Resorts. Ricardo was fantastic and Joel - Sommelier -I just can't say enough good things about them. By the pool Perla, Gabriel & Jorge were fabulous. Juan and Omar at the pool bar kept the drinks flowing. The resort is a little dated but that is part of the charm. We will definitely be back.

Was really in a convenient location. Close walk to town. Friendly people. The steak in the Mexican restaurant was excellent. I would definitely return. I have been to various resorts and this one seems to give you more for the dollar.

This is fast becoming my favorite Palace resort! It is 5-10 minutes from the airport, and is smaller than some of the Palace resorts, which I prefer. The accomodations and service are stellar, and the food is just wonderful. Julio at the front desk was great, as was Marcos in Guest Relations. Breakfast was wonderful, and my favorite server was Marco...he fixed my latte as soon as I walked in the door and took wonderful care of us during our 10-day stay. Ricardo and Bryan in Turguesa also took great care of us, as did Jossie in Momo. Hanna, the hostess at breakfast was so sweet and made sure all our needs were met. Edwin, vacation planner, also was efficient in booking all of our activities. The spa services were great, as well! A most enjoyable stay! I'm going to return 2 more

Great stay. Staff was incredible. Specifically Perla at the Pool Restaurant and Omar at the Pool Bar. Rodrigo at the Lobby bar makes incredible espresso martinis along with his amazing service.  The breakfast was delicious, the lunch was good (get the chicken burrito) And the drinks are strong! Beach current was rough during our stay but had it not been, the access to the water & sand bars are lovely.  Overall 5 stars and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Have been to Cozumel Palace several times now and it truly always is a delightful experience!  The restaurants and food is great and the Staff are so friendly!  It’s always good to see Martha, Joel, Carlos and so many others!  The room care Staff is always on their game (Thank you Maria and others!). The pool staff of Jorge, Jose, and other are always helpful. Then, there’s the Event and Activities Team with Charlie Jackson, Noel, Leslie and many others who keep things moving, entertaining- and always with a very tasteful, respectful‘family’ touch!! Great job by everyone!

My wife and I visited the Cozumel Palace All Inclusive Resort June 8th to June 14th, 2023. This was our first trip to this resort. We have visited many other all inclusive resort chains in the Caribbean. This was one of the best that we have every visited. The food was very good and all the staff were always there to provide great service to make your vacation the best possible.  The  negatives were as follows: 1. The man at the Guest Services desk was very pushy and obnoxious, as he would bother us about booking tours or visiting there sister resort in Playa Del Carmen. 2. The Pina Colada drinks were bland, and with very little flavor. The positives: Rogio - server at the Mexican Rest. was great. Emmanuel and Miguel in the Breakfast and Lunch buffet were also exceptional. The

Reyes the bartender was so personable and attentive it made the whole experience better. This is a smaller resort with employees that get to know you and take care of you. Very nice experience and would definitely come back.

Great resort to unwind with your family.  The staff was excellent.  The amenities were great.  Scuba diving training is offered from within the resort.  Snorkeling is available from the resort.  All in this was one of the best, if not the best, vacations my family and I have ever been on.

We planned, in advance, to have an outside photographer come and do one hour of photos outside for our daughter’s engagement.  This photographer pays for day passes at the Moon Palace all the time to do photography.  Management refused to allow him in saying it was against terms and conditions.    I asked to see the terms and conditions and he refused to show me.  Then he changed what he said and told us we had to pay $1000 dollars to have the photographer be allowed to take pictures.  Then the story changed again and he said it would be $1200.00.  Again I asked to see what terms said that and he would not show me anything.  We then asked the front desk about buying a day pass and they said we could for $150 which we were fine with.  This is the SAME THING that the Moon Palace

This was our 5th time staying at Cozumel Palace.  It is always a pleasure staying there as the staff goes above and beyond to ensure satisfaction.  Ocean front rooms are definitely the most enjoyable and the food is always on par.

Was great.  Older resort but well maintained.  Exceeded our expectations.  The pool area is well laid out and creates a great atmosphere for meeting other members.  The ocean is beautiful, and the snorkeling area is easy to access and awesome.  Here are the employees that made our experience extra nice....  Miguel - Breakfast.  A real gentleman that made breakfast something to look forward to. Hanna - Remembered our names every day and always pointed me to one of the local dishes. Carlos - Super nice, smiles, and laughs while making omelets for us every morning. Angel & Mayra - Always knew what we wanted. This coffee bar is the best among all Palace resorts. Luis - Seen him every morning at gym.  Hard working and cleaning before he headed out to work at pool. Alan and Emmanuel -

Absolutely Love it here! Always feel safe, welcome, and spoiled. The water is always so clear and makes for great snorkeling. Staff are always great and very attentive. Of course the all inclusive drinks and amazing food makes it even better.

The staff make Cozumel Palace a home away from home.  This was our 3rd stay at Cozumel Palace, and we can’t wait to go back again. Our DC, Nina, took great care of us and was extremely responsive and kind.  My daughters love Martha, who greeted us with the warmest hugs.  David, the pool concierge, welcomed us kindly.  Jennifer, our server at the pool, made our pool days extra enjoyable.  Hanna genuinely welcomed us each morning at breakfast.  Antonio, our server at Momo, was just about as professional as you can be.  And the head waiter, Keke (so sorry if I am misspelling his name) accommodated all of our needs and checked up on us. David, at the activity center, accompanied us paddle boarding and kayaking, and was super friendly. The point is that the staff made our stay so

There are not enough words for the excellent service we received.   Ivan was always willing to guide us and our waitresses - Lourdes and Pearla kept us coming back everyday to Flamingos…  All the staff is absolutely amazing.  We will definitely be back.

We went to Cozumel Palace May 24 - June 3 2023 to celebrate a Friends 75th Birthday.  We had an excellent vacay of days by the pool, touring the island, snorkeling the beautiful ocean, shopping, eating fabulous food, drinking awesome drinks....YUM Bumblebees and being pampered by the BEST staff ever!   Following are the staff that made our vacay PERFECTO! Our DC NINA had so much prepared for us before we even arrived and continued to take excellent care of our every need.  Nina made our Friend's birthday and his & wife's anniversary very SPECIAL! She's become a Friend to us and we look forward to our next visit with Cozumel Palace & NINA.   ROCIO, waiter & JUAN, Maitre D @ Bumgambillias...thanks for everything every day! MARTHA, the sweetest hugging smiley hostess @

Cozumel Palace is an intimate, luxurious resort. Access to water sports right from the resort! The staff is superb! Our. Concierge, Nina, made sure all our requests were met and David, our pool concierge, took wonderful care of us every day. The restaurant staffs are exceptional, from Ricardo the manager at Turquesa, Salma, our hostess, and Joel, the sommelier. Every one of them made sure our visit was special. I also want to commend Emmanuel, our lunch waiter at Flamingos, for taking such good care of us.

Bartender and wait staff are wonderful!  Very accommodating and attentive to your needs.  They bring your drinks to the pool or beach and do their best to fulfill any special requests!  These guys are the best!  Luis Alpucho Alfredo Eristian Omar Ojeda

The resort is amazing!!! The stuff working hard from early morning until night time. The room, pool area, garden and beach areas are very clean. The food and drinks are great - lots of choice every day. The entertaiment team is the best we've ever seen (we travel to sun destinations every year).

This is the smallest resort we have stayed at, it had both positives and a few negatives. There are limitations to what is available because of its size but it has such a great laid back and comfortable feeling! The best of the resort was the staff, specifically the entertainment crew, Angel, Christian, David, and Yoni were amazing. They are there all day making sure all guests are having fun, I was blown away by how hard they work!! The wait staff was also incredible! So many to name but highlights for us were Carlos aka "Chocolate" who treated us to a spectacular show while making us a special coffee, and Arcongel, Pedro, Carlos, Jorge, and Clemente in the oriental restaurant were awesome! The downsides were that the buffet food was fair, not great. The beds are VERY firm and

Hotel location is good. It is close to popular scuba diving and snorkeling locations. Resort has good amenities and excellent entertainment. Resort is not very big and it has compact design, everything is in short walkable distance. Food selection might not be as big as other hotels have, but food was good and food in restaurants was delicious. Rooms are a bit small, but we booked 2 rooms for 4 people, so we felt comfortable. And we spent most of our time outside, so it was not an issue. Overall I think we received good value for our money. We enjoyed our vacation.

This is our second stay at Allegro Cozumel. This is a budget hotel catering to families. For the price we paid it was well worth the accommodations. A few minor glitches but nothing to stop us from coming back.  Rooms: Small but adequate and clean. Maid service is perfect.  Buffet Service: Poor. Their focus is turning tables rather than getting drinks or providing any service.  Buffet food: Repetitive and Bland. It's very sad to see so much food waste because the food is not good. I would think the chef would learn to make food taste better and then he could cut down on food cost. We could always find something to eat but it was difficult.  Mexican restaurant: Service was good but food was no better than taco bell.   Italian restaurant: Service was poor. We were put in a corner

The room safe was pretty new with an electronic lock, and to lock it, you need to enter your PIN and press "#". You can unlock it by entering your PIN again. All the workers were extremely friendly, especially the pool guys and the hospitality employees. Lots of activities for different ages! The beaches were very clean and there was lots of excursions to choose from. You would

Really excellent stay.  Hotel is beautiful.  Grounds are lush, well kept.  Several swimming pools, spread apart, so lots of room.  Beach is great, plus can snorkel from beach.  Food surprisingly good at buffets!

We had the best time! All of the staff was so welcoming and friendly. We became friends with many of the staff and even met guests that have become friends I’m sure we will stay in contact with. We will be back next year!

The bartenders at the First Club are outstanding.   Luis, Omar, Alfredo, and Cristian are courteous,  knowledgeable,  and friendly.   The service is superior.   Luis made our trip very enjoyable.  We will be back.

We have been to Cozumel many times over the last 40 years, and this is the first time to the Allegro resort. One of the reasons we chose the resort is that it looked very kid friendly, as we had our children and grandchildren along with  us this trip. They had many activities for the children and adults, the evening entertainment was excellent every night. The resort property itself was exceptionally manicured, and absolutely gorgeous. Plenty of beach, along with palm trees for shade. The food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner were all very good. The specialty restaurants, especially the Oriental restaurant was exceptional. The staff there was exceptional as well. We don't want to leave any names out, but Veronica, Rodrigo, Henry, Omar, Osmond, Luis, Carlos, Pedro, Johnny and

Nice Caribbean feel to the place. No snorkeling from the beach. Great maintenance, comfortable bed and pilows. Rooms not sound proof… For divers, the boat can pick you up form the dock right at the hotel.

Been here ten days now love the resort but had a bad experience with the transportation from airport to the resort first time to the allegro would love to come back but if means using shuttle central for transportation forget it they overcharged one couple of the group for an extra 75$ and haven't been able to get ahold of them for return to airport

Excellent Resort with friendly staff, great food, great beach great pools. 4th time at this resort because it is perfect! I had premium room and access to Santa Rosa bar and mini restaurant wonderful!

Highly recommend and great for everyone... family, solo, with children etc.... Great entertainment and good food for a all inclusive hotel. The Special restaurants was a added bonus. Great open space and multi pools and private beach access was good too.

Lots of activity for the kids.  Overall a pretty good value for money.  There are a couple places on the island that we prefer but they are also much more expensive.  The grounds and rooms were well taken care of and a very friendly staff.

I like the First Club better here at the Sanra Rosa. It has more space, more tables.  Omar, Luis, Alfredo and Cristian are the best. Always smiling,  good service. It wouldn't be as nice without them. The new team of the First Club is also real nice.

Excellent Resort for the price, food is good, excellent variation of drinks, beach is by far the best here for all resorts a huge Shout out to a great employee here who goes above and beyond Henri Maas

The Allegro once again exceeded our expectations. We have stayed there 10 times and have had only 2 incidents where our reservations had not been correct but the staff corrected it and all was good. The staff at the Santa Rosa room were first rate. Omar, Luis, Alfrado, and Cristian did a great job of taking care of us and even opened a little so we could get something to eat before our morning dive. Thank you. As always the staff were friendly and ready to help nonmatter what. Thank you for making us feel welcome again.  The Pro Dive shop at the Allegro is second to none. The service and attention to divers is professional, personal, and safe. We have dove with Pro dive  since 2016 and have over 70 dives with them. We have always felt safe, and well trained while in their care.

Rooms were clean, Empty mini bar upon arrival which was quickly  restocked. A/C worked well. Food was average and could have had more selection and been hotter. Dive shop was unorganized, overpriced and we were overcharged. I definetly was dissappointed with dive shop and  divemaster ability to handle large groups safely. Dove around the world and this is the worst dive shop thus far.

For the most part the resort and the experience was pretty good but the food was across the board horrible to passable, we couldn't get hot water in our shower and the refrigerator barely worked.  The staff was great!

Staff was wonderful.  We went with friends that are first club members and we really enjoyed that experience. Beautiful beach and pools. Plenty of activities and very good food.  Was not ready to come home

I had a wonderful time at the resort! We went diving amlost every day and saw the wonders of the marine life here ! The staff is also very sweet (omar, alfredo, luis y eristian)!  Thanks to everyone! That was perfect vacations!

My stay was mostly good. The pools and beach were very nice, even though there was a bit of seaweed. Hotel can't help that there is a giant mass of seaweed coming their direction. I did not like the lunches. I ate very little and ate lunch out more often. The thing I hate is that I must pay 1 1/2 times all inclusive rate as a single person. I don't drink and I don't overeat at the buffets, so it is frustrating.

Overall the resort is nice. Could use some upgrades and repairs-there was tiles missing from the pool and hot tub, our shower head just stopped staying in an upright position and the shower leaked like crazy, our front window had pulled away from the wall so there was space between etc. The food was good, a little repetitive but we always found something to eat. The Japanese hibachi restaurant was a lot of food but soooo hot, there’s no AC in that room and we were melting. The drinks were great and plentiful and we never had to wait for a drink, the servers and bartenders work hard to anticipate your order and took very good care of us. The beach was clean and had a ton of seats, and even the seating at the pools were plentiful, they could use a few more umbrellas/palapas for

The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The food in the buffet was average.  The speciality resturants were good.  The property and the beach were clean of trash. The day time activities were entertaining.  The property is large so there is a lot of walking involved.

The beach area is very good, especially compared to the Occidental.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  the diving was very good.  The food was less than mediocre.  There were a lot of leftovers and the beef was spongy like it was grown in a lab, not real meat.

This was our first all inclusive trip. Amazing location and friendly staff. Had a good time downtown, snorkeling, ATVs, shopping and just relaxing on the beach. Would recommend as it was great value for our experience.

My husband, daughter and I came here to celebrate her graduation. We were treated like royalty. The entire staff made sure that we were pampered to the fullest! Great food great service and the entertainment team (Chrishon, David Johne & Angel)were out of this world and made the whole day and night so much fun! Thank you Allegro for a very memorable vacation!

Came with a group of friends to celebrate their wedding! Had an absolute blast!!   Loved our waitstaff/servers…..Fioricel, Alfredo, Luis & Cristian! They all went above & beyond for us! So friendly and welcoming!   Entertainment staff was great too….Angel, Johnny & David and there was one more gentleman! They made the trip so much fun!   Highly recommend!

No matter how tempted you are by the price of this hotel do not stay here. The grounds are terrible. The roof has a net on the top. I can see the top of the building. The staff is absolutely so rude. I ask for a drink and they look like they’re annoyed; I try to book restaurants they get annoyed. I wanted the Wi-Fi code and they made me walk all the way down to the office to get it every time. The shower water is cold.  the food is terrible. I refuse to eat it. I actually take a taxi cab every night to the only restaurant by here which is called Alberto’s. It saved my life. The water is freezing. This place is old it’s dirty. The entertainment sucks. Do not stay here. Save your money and stay somewhere else. The only nice thing that I can say is that the water is beautiful

Not a bad resort at all. Was here for 5 days. For the price it’s hard to beat. Don’t expect to have a 5 star resort experience if you’re paying such a good price. Food was ok, upstairs rooms are extremely humid so you may want to try to get a downstairs room. Cristian, Luis, Alfredo, and Floricel did a great job bar tending at the beach.

Great location and a place to have a relaxing time with your family, the staff is not so good they are careless with the customer service and they always look like they are not happy there, most of the staff, not all of them, Customer care will bring more and better customer experiences.  Regards  Sauza Fam

Be very cautious about staying here.  We had a legitimate medical reason to postpone our trip (we were not looking for a refund, only a trabel credit)  Our medical situation fell within the Allegro protocol for last minute cancellation.  They wanted us to cancel without any refund or credit so that they could re-sell the room and make double the money.  I will never book here again

The VIP package was totally worth the additional cost.  It not only gave us access to the premium lounge next to the beach, but the staff that run the area were absolutely top notch.  They were always enthusiastic and quite caring for my elderly mother and her husband.  Floricel, Luis, Alfredo and Christian, thank you all for making our stay easy and care free.  You all made this a trip of a lifetime for myself and my family.

The Staff was amazing. The food was alright.  The hibachi was the best experience. My only concern is there needs to be mooooore air conditioning. We had a good trip and thought the Entertainment was awesome.

We had a great stay at the Allegro Cozumel. The beach is beautiful. There were enough chairs available at the pool and beach while we were there. The pools are nice and clean. The food and drinks are good. The staff was kind. Great Dive Shop on site. Great dives.  The grounds are beautiful and well kept. We found the resort to be very clean. It is a nice resort for families. We were on a couple vacation but they have a great pool and activities for kids.  Can't really think of anything to complain about, except maybe mentioning that it is true that the rooms have no soundproof. We would stay at the Allegro Cozumel again and hope to go back soon!

All restaurants and buffets need help in the quality department. Bland foods, warm fruit, and warm juice. The specialty restaurants were better than the buffet, but not by much. All restaurants were hot and not comfortable to eat in.

Beautiful Resort. The grounds are gorgeous and the beach is amazing, just not my style. I like to snorkel and there is no snorkeling here so don't pack your gear unless you plan day trips out of the resort. The specialty restaurants are wonderful. The buffet is buffet food, nothing special. Only went up there once as it's way too warm in there to eat comfortably. Our room, 6624, was dated, but loved the location of it. 1 building back from beach, facing the jungle, so our balcony was very private and the sounds coming from the jungle was music to my ears.

The resort is great for families with young children.  However I do not recommend for adult- only travelers.  Grounds were nice.  Beach was great.  I enjoyed my bungalow room, but the food situation leaves much to be desired.  I believe the resort boasts 6 restaurants, but you only have 1 option for breakfast,  1 option for lunch,  and 1-3 options at dinner...IF you get a reservation. Toy can't take food from the cafeteria ( like you're a school kid) and they're no food between meal times...no food options! When I go to a resort I expect to eat wherever,  whenever.  I like to eat a snack on the beach,  but you can't do that here... I'm sure it's to keep the property clean and reduce kid messes, but I'm not a kid. If I want a sandwich & chips on the beach I should have that!

Johnny, David and Angel are great as event coordinators, they keep things upbeat and fun. There are fun pool and beach activities all day as well as evening shows and there guys are just amazingly funny and witty!

The hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful. The staff is outstanding and always helpful when needed. All areas to eat are nice and the buffet is nice and a wide variety of food.  The staff out front is always there within seconds to help you with your needs of travel.

We absolutely loved our stay at this resort.  Our group consists of two 50 year olds, two 19 year olds and two 16 year olds.  The entertainment staff is truly amazing.  We loved Johny, Chris, Angel and David.  They made us all feel very welcome.  I highly suggest you participate in the activities these guys lead.  Also the shows are great at night. We also chose to have premium rooms and had access to the premium lounge.  Let me tell you the guys that work in this lounge are so attentive.  Great coffee, lunch and great drinks.  Thank you Christian, Floricel, Luis and Alfredo. Rooms are plain but very clean.  We found the beds to very comfy. Beach was great and the pool areas were always clean.  We usually don't return to the same resort but we are already talking about retuning

So if you're looking for high brow you'll likely be disappointed but we loved our vacation here! It's nothing fancy but for the price you have everything you need,  good drinks, food, beach, pools and the beds were very comfy.  As a mom of 3 I just loved that i didn't have to cook or clean up after my kids for a week and got to sit on a beach drinking a pina colada instead.  I also loved the variety of Mexican, Argentinean and European families we met!  There was the rowdy American crowd decked out in all their American flag shirts - as if anyone could mistake them for anything else -  but they tended to herd together on one side of the beach which we avoided.

Staff is wonderful, rooms clean, pools clean, beach beautiful and clean (even with the seaweed problem they have been having the past couple of years), food in restaurants - good to very good, lunch and dinner buffet food, not so much (pretty bland, sauces VERY thin and bland, if you like spicey, take your own hot sauce, otherwise - take your own salt and pepper.  Make sure you take enough sunscreen, Off Spray, and Aloe and that you don't have to buy anything in the hotel store - EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE.   Cigarettes are hard to come by and to buy due to Mexico's country wide smoking band, but there are still areas in resort where you can smoke.   Most of the resort is wheelchair friendly, but not the beach area.  Even if you can walk a little bit, you will have a very hard time

We chose Allegro Cozumel for our family vacation this year and we enjoyed our stay very much. One of the highlights of our VIP Package experience was the access to the VIP lounge. Floricel, Luis, Alfredo, and Christian made our time at the VIP pool and lounge comfortable and very enjoyable. We appreciate all the attention by the staff, the cleanliness, the friendliness and all the help we received. We had a wonderful time and are very grateful for the wonderful service!

For the price this was a 5.  Rooms and Beach were nice.  Drinks were really weak.  Food was just OK. Our biggest complaint would be that the Buffet is all closed in with tall ceilings and fans.  It was extremely HOT every morning and evening.  No air conditioning anywhere except the Italian restaurant, spa, gym and rooms.  I would never go back in the summer. Room air conditioner worked well.

Fernando was a wonderful and very attentive beach /pool server, he made sure we had everything we needed!  We enjoyed the day pass from the cruise and had fun at the activities lead by David, Angel, Christian and Jonny.

My family enjoyed a package stay at the Allegro resort, and it was outstanding. The beach snorkeling, scuba diving, food, and entire stay was something I will not forget.  My humblest thanks to Omar, Luis, Alfredo, and Cristian. They staffed the Premier club and took excellent care of us. I cannot wait to return.

The Pro's: Beautiful resort. Beautiful Pools and Beach. Entertainment staff is great. Most of the staff was very helpful. Very family friendly  The Con's and reason we will never go back: You need to have a real passion to sweat all the time, its their motto. The only AC in the resort is your room and the Italian restaurant. The rest of your meals come dripping with sweat from breakfast to dinner. No air movement at all. We were there 6 days and they only allow 2 reservations during our stay. Out of the 3 restaurants.....only two are open each night. The oriental food was delicious. The italian restaurant was horrible. The buffet food is below average for mexican resorts. This was our 3rd different Barcelo resort in mexico, this is the only one that did not have waiters at the

Overall a good time! Property is beautiful, staff is wonderful. Food choices ok, allowed 3 reservations to dinner restaurants during our stay, those were good, buffets were just ok. Daytime entertainment was great, played volleyball on the beach and in the pool, tennis, pickle ball. Snorkeling and kayaking on property.

We enjoyed the beach, pools, and drinks. The kids especially enjoyed the slides & kid pool. Everything was clean and staff was very nice and helpful. David and Angel made it extra fun with the day and night time activities! Overall great family vacation!

Amazing service!!! Carlos Perez has been wonderful and the most accommodating!  Evanelly Lope and Guadelupe  Jimenez were also the absolute best! We will always come back and request them! Thank you for everything you do!!

Our travel agent booked us this hotel for 8 days since there is a dive club on the hotel grounds. We had a wonderful time here. Ok, we were a lot under water for scuba diving but the moments we were not diving, we had a great time. The staff is really friendly and helpfull. The rooms are always clean. The barmen serve perfect drinks and the food was really great with a wide variety of choices. I wish I could thank some people, but I don’t know their names. It’s the older barman at the poolbar near the beach and the 2 girls who greet the guests at the restaurant and bring them to their seats. They always had a friendly smile for you and sometimes when there was time also a little chat. Can’t wait to come back here.

I can hardly understand what it takes to keep a place like that running but they do it. From the dishwashers, cooks, housekeeping, servers, hosts, security, and entertainers they work hard to take care of the guests.

Christian, Floricel, Luis and Alfredo were very attentive and gave excellent service.  They served our drinks at the beach or the pool.  We really enjoyed our time.  Reall enjoyed our time there and Geaux Tigers!

We had a great family vacation at Allegro. There were two families with 3 teenagers and there was always something to do. Angel and David did a wonderful job getting us all involved and making sure we had fun. Beautiful beach, plenty of lounge chairs, and Carlos, the afternoon beach bartender, makes the best drinks; be sure and ask him for his specialty: a six pack (it’s delicious!) we would definitely come back and we miss it and our new friends already!

Sergio, Christian, and Omar are amazing and Jorge is the best housekeeper we have ever had!  The beach is amazing and I highly recommend paying for the premium rooms--closer to the beach and better service in general.

Booked a flight/resort package and the original resort was not exactly up to par with just about anything.. Called Allegro and they had availability at an excellent all inclusive price! From the moment you set foot there you know you are in a professionally maintained environment! All staff, from maintenance to manager is excellent! Rooms have both A/C and CEILING FANS. Compared to the other resorts I've stay in the north and mid part of the island, this is def a plus! This place is excellent for a couples trip, which is what I went for, and for family! You have immediate and clean beach access, swim up bars, which close a little too early but I guess for good reason. Tried the

We visited in mid-April and the resort was beautiful and the staff friendly. The pools and beach were as good as any one could ask for and were really clean and not crowded. As a whole this resort is great and we will be coming back.  For the bad news don't go expecting to get drunk off the drinks. All of the liquor we tried was super watered down, so not much alcohol in any drink. However they are free so you can't complain too much.  Another thing was letting vendors into the resort to pester you about buying trinkets in the resort.  You are bothered everywhere on the island about spending money ,you shouldn't be bothered in the resort

We came to Allegro Resort during our 1st and now 25th anniversary.  It has a very nice and natural beach, great accommodations, food/drink, entertainment, and more!  Second time here and will be back again!

My Girlfriend and I (Mid 20s) stayed here for 8 nights. We give our experience at the resort a 3 stars, but we are bias and think for many this could be 4-5 stars.  To start Barcelo as a company and the Allegro Hotel were great experiences. The resort is beautiful and the staff is beyond exceptional.   Pros: Staff is friendly and hard working. Room Service cleans well.  4 bars making drinking easy. Beach is beautiful and well maintained. Food is safe to eat and there is always something to eat. While it is bland (just has less sugar than US food) there are yummy foods and neither of us got sick. AC was ice cold and fridge was always restocked.   Cons: We were on the second floor and the walls aren’t connected to the ceiling so you can hear literally everything in all rooms

Save yourself do not stay place was disgusting room stink with bugs. Staff rude specially isabel sanches horrible place worse ever!!! Food gross. Bathroom gross dirty. The worse part is the stafff so rude

All the staff at allegro was super friendly and accommodating! We always felt cared for and had unlimited food and drinks to satisfy our needs. The hibachi grill and the Italian restaurant were the best! We also loved chilling at the premium bar and pool. Alfredo, Christian, Omar, and Luis were super friendly and professional!

The diving was absoluting amazing. The weather was also very warm and fuzzy. The food, for the most part, was very delicious and the server, Danny, was the best. The property was extremely well managed but the ac had some problems. It was all sorted out and was overall a wonderful experience.

Occidental Cozumel is great!  The resort is super safe.  You have to pass a security guard to get into or out of the resort.  The staff are all amazing!  Super wonderful people who make you smile every day!  The food is decent.  Always something new to try at the buffets.  The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.  We had a massage at the spa and they are wonderful!  The only thing I would give 4 stars is the beach.  Not a big beach area and part of it where there are trees is great for shade but kind of hard to get into and out of the water.  The open beach area would be great if you could have umbrellas or something there for some shade, maybe an option to rent the umbrella? None of this prevented us from laying on the beach!!  We enjoyed our trip and plan to come back

Beautiful place to stay with clean and spacious rooms and enough entertainment. Only the restaurant is not great. Lunch and breakfast are fine but the dinner is not of great quality. Pool was nice and the beaches were very clean!

Take small bills, no change available unless you want a pocket full of pesos. Food was great, staff friendly and helpful. Take advantage of excursions, especially the Submarine excursion was amazing. Tip the staff up front for a great result.

The staff was friendly and engaging, shout out to Axel, Jesus, Celso, and Sergio. We enjoyed all of the activities onsite in addition to activities we did on the island. Pro Dive onsite was a professional and enthusiastic group, many thanks to Nanoo and Sami.

Had a fabulous time at the resort!! The resort is clean and staff friendly. Food pretty good. Everyone at the Mexico Lindo was great and the food there fantastic! Thank you Sulio, Dpoung, Nononb and Candy!! Definitely recommend coming here! The weather and vibe were just amazing!!

We visited Occidental on Mar26-Apr01 as a family group of 9:  6 adults and 3 children ages from  3 to 9. We are well travelled, been to multiple Caribbean resorts (Mexico, Dominican, Grenada, St Lucia, Cuba,. We usually go to 4.5 star resorts.  After reading all the bad reviews we came prepared for the worse. However, we experienced nothing of what was mentioned in bad reviews . All of us had a wonderful week there.  Food: We mostly ate at buffet restaurant (b/c of kids, hard to schedule). Food was tasty, almost home-made taste. All of us had different preferences but nobody was disappointed with choices.  Restaurants: we only been to Seafood restaurant (beachfront), good selection of dishes to choose from. All were happy with choices.  Drinks: we drunk various drinks/cocktails

Its almost identical to pictures . Due to erosion the beach is much smaller ( there are 2 row of palm trees for now). Keep in mind that certain tourists do not was their feet before going into the pool resulting in sand being in the pool. Rooms are clean , stuff is friendly . Great place to relax after escaping ice rain .

Awesome. I enjoyed the stay I wish I was there longer. Very friendly and hard working staff. Food was tasty and had variety each day. Bathroom cleanliness hotel room pool everything overall very clean and just overall a great time. Can’t wait to go again.

Wonderful atmosphere and food and a great  mystery drink!  We had salad and steak and a Mexican dessert.   All was very good!  Sergio, Norma and Horhe provided awesome service and they were so much fun! -Memphis

We took our 12 year old on his first dive trip and stayed at the Occidental in the Royal Level.  It was amazing.  The grounds and rooms were clean and well kept, and the pools were great!  The best part of the trip was the staff.  Everyone was incredibly kind and helpful.  We ate the majority of our meals at La Carreta and can't say enough good things about Rogelio, Felipe, Guadalupe, Carlos, Paola, and Jocelyn.  Thank you for making our stay perfect!

This is a great resort. Beautiful tropical jungle grounds. Very comfortable rooms. Great service and good food. Nice beach, and snorkelling/ scuba diving on premises. What more could one possibly want? ;)

This resort comes at an excellent price point for what you get.  The staff, all staff, are so friendly and responsive.  Everything from check-in to check-out was excellent. I look forward to returning in the future.

Top notch, plan to return year after year. The food was outstanding, the rooms were private with beautiful mangrove views. Privacy and security was top notch. Loved being AWAY from busy ports- no cruise ships obstructing your beautiful ocean views. FUN pools, bars and staff overall was outstanding.

Since the fire and the loss of several units this resort seems to be struggling. The service is lacking so much since the last time my wife and I were there. The staff and beachfront were the two best things on the resort. It’s like the resort is struggling to stay afloat even though I know the resort is part of the Occidental and Barcelo group.

Not up to the same level as the first time we were there.  The beach has serious erosion, the food at the buffets was disappointing, and our room was musty and the level of humidity caused our bedding and the couch to feel damp. Make sure to use the room safe; my wedding ring and a bracelet were missing after I neglected to lock them in the safe. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Just got back from a glorious week at Occidental Cozumel. I stayed in the master suite in the royal club. It is an absolutely gorgeous resort. But what really makes it stand out are the people!   Every single person who works there are so friendly and helpful and always have a smile for you.    I mostly ate at La Carreta and the food was fabulous! Order the Mexican coffee for a special treat with a show! I can’t say enough for the staff there. They are the absolute best!!! Carlos, Felipe, Guadalupe and Rogelio thank you so much! Rogelio you consistently go above and beyond for your customers, you are truly amazing! I have been coming here for years and can’t recommend it enough. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Positives:  1. Ramon Soltero is top notch. His customer service deserves acknowledgement. 2. Overall attention to detail at resort. 3. First Club accommodations. Areas of improvement: 1. Drain in shower was slow.

Rogelio, Felipe, Guadalupe, Carlos and the team at La Careta made me and ny brother feel like Royalty!!! We looked forward to seeing them everyday. My brother was celebrating his birthday and they went above and beyond!!

The resort is beautiful. We were nervous about reports of people being sick but we did not experience any issues. We love the Relax pool and Victor who works the bar there. It seems silly to close the pool bar at 5 when there are still alot of people there. There should also be a towel exchange at the Relax pool. Other than that we had a great trip. Great service and we loved our room, room 2112. Thanks for a great stay

Excellent service perfect place to relax and enjoy the forest and recommend.to see the beauty of life.  The food es delicious and the restaurant are combined so it’s  at your choice.  The pool it’s perfect whit a play place por everyone con enjoy it.

Impeccable service and staff.  Old fashioned courtesy and attention to guests. (far above what we receive in the US nowadays!) Variety of foods, epic views, relaxing atmosphere. Nice alternative to the hotel zones in Cancún.

If you don't dive, I don't think you will find much to do here.  The beach is almost nonexistent.  The people working there are really nice.  The food is ok at the buffet but good luck getting reservations to the "specialty" restaurants. We did get to play Pickleball several times on a partially painted court. The expensive excursions were not worth it.  Just sad, sad, sad.

There are lots of things to do with the pools and beach.  All the restaurants are great but the specialty Mexican was our favorite!  The food and staff were excellent!  It is easy to book excursions when you get to the resort and many leave right from their pier or front gates!  Goodbye for now Occidental!  We will be back soon!

The service was unreal . This is a place you can’t miss . You are going to have the time of your life and the good food and wine and service. Donny and Juan and Noama are so amazing . Thank you Accidental Cozumel Hotel for the great time you provide to us.  Sauza Family

Absolutely wonderful!! Will definitely be back!! Good food, gfeat service,  wonderful people! Have not been disappointed at all!  Great staff. We were here for breakfast,  lunch and dinner.  They were all attentive!!

The ac and mini fridge didn’t work, and the card reader to our room died locking us out. It took ages to get any help and the AC never got fixed.  I wish I had saved my money and stay home.

Our stay at Occidental well exceeded my expectations.  I was a little worried after recent bad reviews, but our stay was amazing.  Every staff we experienced was friendly, efficient and welcoming. For the most part, the people working at the resort are amazing—not so much for the management we dealt with. We were running late to breakfast, but never was it mentioned to us that we were too late and should not come, and it was a 30 minute drive from our hotel. Nomey and Ismael made the dinner wonderful. We were celebrating my dad's 70 th birthday, and they made it so special. Thank you, the food was fabulous and the dinner will be remembered forever. Thank you!

Dinner at the Mexican restaurant was  delicious!  The food was great and the service was superb.  We had Noemy, Edit, and Ismael as our servers and they were so nice.  They made a Birthday so special and we really appreciate how they went above and beyond.

Nine of us arrived excited for a week of good food, drinks and daily excursions. Six of us spent most of the week in the bathroom with dysentary like sickness. I did not expect much from the food at an all inclusive resort.  But my lord, the only excursion I took all week was to the toilet 24 hours a day.  We left a day early (escaped to safety) so we could begin recovering. Other than that nightmare, the staff was very nice.  Two other small issues. The Royal Level “Concierge” advertised is not real. Just a guy at a desk that tells you to go to other people with your questions. Or they try to direct you through timeshare scams and all that kind of business.  The Royal Level “private” restaurant should be avoided unless you want diarrhea to ruin your week.

Before we arrived Jesus was waiting with a huge smile ready to grab our bags! Free beach towels, free breakfast, massages, books to read, an incredible bar and restaurant to name a few. There were plenty of places to eat in Cozumel, but we ate every meal there, it is that good!  The rooms were immaculate and the views blew me away.  Take a camera and make sure you are in a few of the pictures otherwise people wouldn't believe this place exists! Very nice hotel with beautiful polls, restaurant area and great views of ocean.  Rooms are clean and nice with great little balconies. For me only downside is the bed mattress is so hard my back was hurting all night.

Outside the hotel was beautiful, gorgeous scenery and enjoyed eating with the view. But I  was very disappointed by the room we got . It smelled funny and no electrical outlets by bed. Was uncomfortable for me and my 2 kids. I would not have stayed longer than 1 night

Hotel B Unique is a first class hotel in a stunning location away from the crowds. Everything was classy from the sheets to the staff. Breakfasts were free and included huge bowls of fresh fruit which I appreciated. It was easy to cycle or take a taxi into town for something different. My work-cation was made possible by the excellent internet and quiet surroundings. Highly recommend this romantic, clean, and comfortable spot.

Hotel boutique with an excellent service, modern rooms. Staff are very friendly, ask for Alberto who will give you everything you need at the restaurant and bar! Alain the Manager, always there to help you have the best staying!

The wait staff was wonderful, behind the front desk helped us with excursions and covid 19 test, restaurant very accommodating, room cleaned very well each day, laundry service returned the same day. Food was excellent.

Staying at Miramar next to hotel B and we tried it out for dinner despite previous reviews. I’m not a complainer because I work in a restaurant so I get that stuff can happen but the whole meal was very disappointing. It took over an hour to get our food with only 12 people in the dining room. Server was okay but the food sucked! It all tasted very old and didn’t have any flavor like others have said. Pad Thai didn’t taste like pad Thai, salmon was mushy (way over marinaded) & sushi tuna was discolored and old, ceviche was okay but not great, quesadilla tasted like old reheated steak. My wife ordered 2 meals herself because she was excited to try some stuff and she literally threw both of them away when we got back and ate a sandwich back at the condo instead. Very cool

Best value in Cozumel!! Clean big rooms, great staff, the pools and lounge areas are luxurious and great snorkeling right in front of  The property. The food is very good and offers a full bar. Any thing you may need the staff will make it happen

There were several amenities that are clearly advertised on the site/booking confirmation that were not provided. We are very easy/understanding travelers and are easily pleased but feel that if something is advertised (especially when we are paying for a luxury hotel) we feel our concerns should at least be acknowledged. We had such a great stay at Hotel B! The rooms were bright and clean with wonderful ocean views. Every single employee we interacted with was helpful, kind and friendly.  The snorkeling right off the dock was full of life and a great way to enjoy the afternoon! Jesus was so friendly, knowlegable and helped us book some of our favorite adventures of our whole trip!  Joel, Juan and George all offerd excellent service at the resturant. The food was some of the best we ate the whole trip! Gracias Amigos!

The hotel unique B is great for couples. Amazing installations, great staff, nice restaurant and bar! Our stay was very pleasant and if we are coming back to Cozumel, we will definitely stay there again!

My friends and I booked 2 rooms. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, there were multiple duplicate charges on both bills. We were charged 360 pesos for cucumber garnish on my drinks. Charged for alcoholic beverages for the kids. They added additional tips to the bills.   Crooked crooked crooked.   When we said we wanted it fixed they threatened to call the police.   Hotel rooms were basic on the "family" side, not very family friendly.   The pool was nice, decent snorkeling, no beach.   Would not stay again.

Really nice hotel, situation perfect and specially with amazing service. You have the sea downstairs of the rooms, transparent water and warm. The best hotel you can stay for not so much money. Ask Fabian he will make the best service during your stay

The service was non-existent with the exception of one gentleman, Fabian, that was serving us by the pool.  The food was average at best.  If you do stay at the hotel, I would suggest going into to town for meals.  Breakfast is included but watch out for the hidden charges and again, the service is so poor it can take 30-60 minutes to get water or coffee after being seated at your table.  We could not understand why because the restaurant was certainly not busy.  One morning I had to ask 4 different servers to get our coffee and juice.  Ended up going to the bar to get the juice.  The room had a nice view of the ocean however the bed was certainly dated as the mattress sank in the middle.  The bathroom smelled like sewage where we had to throw towels over the drains to reduce

The accommodations and service were fine, but the outdoor DJ blasting club beat music non-stop from 5-midnight was ridiculous.  This was even more irritating given that the dance floor was right next to the fine-dining restaurant.  I literally could not have a conversation with anyone at our table and we couldn't even communicate with our waiter.

a place taken from a fairy tale everything absolutely everything was magnificent all the theme is beautiful without a doubt my eyes were enchanted, and after the massage that I took with the attention of Miss Itzel spa manager amazed to feel so relaxed and at peace with myself, the room service is the best although it takes a while but thanks to the charismatic young Guzmán When you get to the room, you forget that it took them a while to bring it because of the kindness it has for you, and that you don't have to ask for the name of each one who is there for your service. Rooms were dated and in need of upgrading. Mattress was not comfortable and no refrigerator or microwave. No plugs near the bed for cell phones. It was expensive considering the room quality. Food and service and location was excellent though.

The perfect place to relax & be pampered 😁 I recommend this Hotel with 5 Stars with VIP service ✨️  The pools were amazing, snorkeling is out of this world!  Our lunch was perfect, rooms are clean I will definitely be back!!!

What a delightful surprise to experience this truly UNIQUE setting with caring thoughtful service and touches everywhere  Personalized plants honoring employees on the tables , hammocks in fun places , ocean access in style , intriguing decor  and so much more  - wow! Caring employees like Claudia in the restaurant and Urania in housekeeping made it even more special   We will Beeee back !

I had been here before and had a decent experience, but today was awful.  The food was overcooked and bland.  The bacon I ordered never came and in the end it was still on my bill even though the waiter said he forgot.  He offered to buy me a drink later... sorry won't be back.

We booked a ocean view room and oh man, we got a fantastic beautiful ocean view with 1 of the 4 walls of the hotel room was a floor to ceiling glass door that opened to a west facing balcony. We watched many sunsets here.   Service was exemplary especially Marin and Juan Carlos who served us at the restaurant when we were feeling lazy and just wanted to snorkle around the hotel. The snorkling was so cool too - right in front. Saw star fish, squid, and so many schools of fish.

Staying at a beach hotel is usually a synonym of relaxing, resting and having a good time. Unfortunately, our experience was totally the opposite. The room was by far substandard. Yes, the view was stunning but the mattresses were all worn out, very old and with lumps everwhere. This was my first time to Cozumel and to Mexico. We brought our 3 children (aged 15/18/19).  The location and amenities are great!  We spent a few afternoons just lounging by the pool enjoying a cocktail.  Some of the guests there were actually doing a 'day pass' from a different hotel on the island because Hotel B is that nice.    The rooms are sparse yet clean.  We stayed in the older section (Hotel B) side.  The newer building that you enter through is 'Hotel B Unique' and is adults only.  With our 3 older teens - we had to stay in the older side to put 3 in a room.  The rooms are nothing fancy, but the beds were comfortable, there is space for hanging, folding your clothes, a coffee pot, TV, and hair dryer and space for our dive gear.  As others have mentioned - there is no

The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms we stayed in provided an unique ocean view, were clean,comfy and could use a litle doover to match the breathtaking view.  Breakfast was delicious, but the hot choclate (among other things) was only available at an extra charge which seems a little nitpicking considering the room rates.  That said it has to be noted that lunch and dinner in the restaurant were outstanding. The concept of MexicanAisanFusion works pretty well.  The pool area is great and the infinity pools provide unforgettable memories.

We had such a great vacation and a big part of it was Hotel  Unique. This was our second stay here and we plan on coming back. The whole staff gave superb service. Vanessa was especially helpful in coordinating our rentals and giving local restaurant recommendations. We also went fishing, brought back a fish and the chef made us a special meal out of it. Their bar had tasty juices and cocktails which were perfect for drinks in the pool to watch the sunset. We also snorkeled every day since it was so convenient.

Just got back from coz. stayed at hotel b. this place has it all. The best snorkling on the isle, right in front of the hotel. Two great infinite pools to watch the sunsets. great views from every room. a huttub on a cliff you can dive off of into the blue waters. free breakfasts, a great friendly staff, cool a.c. in rooms. i could go on and on. instead, we are making plans to go back asap!

One half of the hotel is adults only, to include the pool.  The staff was amazing, and the front desk was there to help with everything you could possibly need.  Easy access to the ocean and snorkeling right in front of the hotel.  Taxis were easily available and I loved my experience.

So many amazing places to eat in Cozumel. This is not one of them.   Don’t eat here, especially if you are on diets like keto, sugar busters, Atkins or any low carb diet. The only menu item I could find was a tuna disk, when it arrived it was all rice with a little piece of avocado and a smaller piece of tuna. When I explained, they said they could take it back but would still charge me! I asked for the manager; they came back in 10 minutes and said the manager would be there in another  10 minutes.  I left and my friends were not charged for my meal. Their meals were uninspired and very expensive. Cozumel has amazing restaurants and this is not one of them.

Our 4th time staying at Hotel B, I can honestly say it gets better each and every time! I love that if you stay at either the B or B Unique properties (next door/adjoined) that you get to enjoy the offerings and amenities at both properties. The new adult pool at B Unique is amazing, as well as their restaurants culinary offerings and beverages.  Look forward to our next opportunity to visit (hopefully sooner rather than later)!

Absolutely Stunning!!!  One of the most relaxing hotels I've had the privilege of staying at.  As you walk in, you are welcomed with a cool breeze passing through the hotel lobby. We were kindly greeted by concierge who offered a cold face towel and a  complimentary healthy juice shot.  After check-in, a few steps to the observation deck allows you to gaze into the beautiful turquoise water Cozumel is known for.  You also have views of the familial pool, adult pool and the hotel lagoon commonly seen in all the photos.  The hotel sits on a edge of the ocean shelf creating calm, clear water.  This allows for breathtaking oceans views and access to jet skiing and snorkeling right in front of the hotel.  We had a chance to do both and would highly recommend it, both for convenience

The B Cozumel part of the hotel is really outdated with showers that don't work properly, bathrooms that contain fungus.  But once you step outside your room you enter paradise! The pool areas are great and so is the restaurant/bar

Dinner in the restaurant. Optically really nice fusion design with local and European style elements. Service bad ( took almost 30 mins for tje deink and restaurant was almost empty ), dishes served were OKish, forgot the tostadas, came 15mins later when we were finished. Definitely not going to be repeated.

We had the most incredible stay at Hotel B! The rooms, service and food are to such a high standard! I would definitely recommend upgrading to Hotel B Unique for an extra $80 a night! The pools and amenities are exquisite! We loved our stay!

David, Manuel, Pablo, and all of the staff at Hotel B are amazing. The food and drinks are great. The atmosphere at the pool and hot tub is unmatched. The rooms are comfortable and affordable.  I will be back!!

We were on a cruise ship docked for the day, it’s 1000 pesos pp and you get that back in food and drink. came here because the pictures looked amazing, Manuel was superb, food was amazing too, we had beef and fish tacos, with the Peruvian and Thai ceviche and shared the blackened fish taki rolls!  We Love it and will be coming back! Thanks again Miguel!

The Hotel is absolutely beautiful, the view from the room amazing. The service incredible, the staff very kind and helpful. Best place to chill on your holidays.  Went with my family for a much needed vacation, I will definitely come back.

My visit to Hotel B was so memorable. The staff was so friendly and the view from our oceanfront was out of this world. The price was great, the hotel facilities are complete and the service was outstanding. Definitely my new favorite place

We love Hotel B and have been there often. The staff remember us and welcome us warmly. Manuel is very attentive and Claudia is the sweetest. Jesus is hugely helpful and the front desk staff are just wonderful.

We went to Hotel B because the view, food, and drinks are perfect.   The first time we came was around a month ago. A group of 15 of us, cruise ship performers, came to Hotel B. We had dinner at the restaurant last night and the food was amazing. If you like nice ambience this is definitely the place to go. The accent lights and candles, the relaxing music, the beautiful sunset, all add up to a wonderful experience. Thank you Daniel🙏

It was an incredible place to spend with my husband. Was so romantic to watch the sunset there. The service is incredible, the food quality is also really good. For sure we are coming back in our next trip to Cozumel. Nice ambience.

I will never return or refer due to the fact that staff are all hustlers. We booked a catamaran and ended up with an old fishing boat. This hotel is full of hustlers and frauds as part of their staff. They need to train their staff on how to treat their guests. I am very displeased with my stay.

Hotel B is our favorite place to stay in Cozumel! The rooms also have safes, which is always comforting.  It would be useful, though, if the rooms also added a mini-fridge, but reception is very quick to provide a bucket of ice, if desired.  Breakfast is provided, there are good choices, and it's well prepared; over a long stay , it might seem repetitive. Great hotel! 5min by car/taxi from ferry port and Cozumel downtown. Incredible view  to the sea from the open area of the reception which invites you to discover the rest of the hotel. Nice welcome from the reception team + 2 healthy juice offered and highly appreciated. We arrived earlier so our room was not yet ready but the hotel staff proposed us to use all the facilities (pool, restaurant, etc.). While waiting we discovered the restaurant with its high ceiling and nicely decorated. The hamburger was just fantastic. The restaurant is fine. The breakfast is very limited in its selection and you have to order coffee, milk, juice, water, butter, omelette, spoons and more with the waiter. We enjoyed lovely couples massages as well as beautiful sentimental features including making a wish, picking a scent and having it explained to us why we were drawn to that specific scent, a lovely private jacuzzi and balcony complete with delicious champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. A truly fantastic 5 senses experience! Filomena and Reina were our massage therapists and they were very accommodating and skillful, checking in on pressure and bringing a lovely energy to the whole experience.

Great little hotel overlooking the ocean and the infinity pool.  from the room, it felt like we were on a cruise ship.  staff was amazing and made us feel at home.  We staying on the ocean side, in the adults only area.  Will return for sure (with a larger ice bucket ).

We ordered one bottle of wine that the waiter told us it costs 50$us and then in the bill was 92$us. Till then i was having such a good time but ruined my mood completely. On top Of that the bottle of wine was room temperature when it supposed to be cold. The pool is nice though and the food was ok.  I will not return.

Lovely place with beautiful ocean view and clean and comfortable rooms. Amenities were great and the restaurant has some delicious options. Staff was very kind and helpful. The spa was a big highlight and a great experience that I totally recommend

Place was super clean! Staff all friendly.  Pool and beach area are really nice! They even have morning yoga. Beds were comfortable. great shower. Close to city center,  would highly recommend staying here.

We took our 12 yr old grandson to Cozumel for spring break. He wanted to stay where he could snorkel right from the hotel.  Hotel B was perfect.  Tons of fish right off the hotel.  They even have a large diving platform so if you have younger kids who are not strong swimmers, they can take a break on the platform while others snorkel.  The restaurant was amazing!!! The food was fabulous.  We normally don't eat at a hotel because the food isn't always the best.  Hotel B's restaurant was outstanding.  They even cooked Mahi that we caught when we went deep sea fishing.  The views from our room was beautiful.  It's about an easy mile walk to town or you can take a taxi for $4-$5.  There's a nice sandy beach easy walking distance just past the hotel. Everyone was so friendly and

The bed was insanely comfortable and the staff were very friendly and amazing at their jobs. We felt included and like family. The yoga was top notch! I loved swimming in the pools and the ocean, and that there was an adults only area. It's a small portion of the total public area so if you are a family there are lots of family friendly areas including the larger pool. Very nice atmosphere to relax. I loved watching the sunset from the hammocks :)

This is an awesome location, right on the water. The pools are beautiful, and the views fabulous, but the service lacks a little 'polish'. Service was generally painfully slow - even for a drink. There is a pretty strong sewerage smell in the bathrooms, but I think that's common in may places in this area, due to the poorly developed sewerage system. The restaurant felt much too expensive for what it was, and the food was odd. Asian fusion, but not done particularly well. The sax player one evening at sunset was spectacular - those are the sorts of things that will stay with me. The breakfast was delicious, and great that it was included. Be aware that there is not really anything within walking distance, you need to get a taxi/scooter to the town centre.

Cool spot, pools are great and ocean swimming off the rocks was fun. The only thing missing is a real beach. We stayed in the new building right after it was completed in late 2019. Rooms were adequate. Great staff & some of the best coffee I've ever had. Rent scooters and tour the coastal areas of the island! Avoid the inland neighborhoods.

What stroke me the lost was the cleanliness of the premises, friendless of the staff and the variety of the food served. We will be returning to Cozumel and staying at the Grand Park for sure.

All staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The Funtastic team, particularly Ricardo and Alejandro, were enthusiastic and entertaining, making our stay very enjoyable.   Night shows, particularly the magic show, were high energy and professionally composed.  Food at specialty restaurants was fantastic.  Expertly prepared. Awareness/display of foods containing peanuts for severe, potentially lethal allergies, required.  Hotel emergency response staff requiring on-going/up-dated first aide training as my daughter had fainted from dehydration and staff proceeded to attempt to perform CPR while she was conscious.

Entertainment at the pool was not consistent . Need more activities for adults around pool  I will suggest to make reservations for the restaurants for Fridays and Saturdays when the majority of the hotel is booked , then you don’t have to wait around for 20 minutes

We went for our college spring break and had an amazing time. The resort was beautiful and very clean and we felt super safe. All of the employees were super welcoming and kind. The entertainment team was super fun and there were a ton of activities to do all day. We loved the foam party, karaoke, snorkeling and water aerobics. The food and drinks were very good. The bikini bar had great tacos for lunch and the restaurants had great dinner options. We would recommend this resort to anyone. For spring breakers, one thing to know is that the bars close at 12, but there are many bars close to the resort.

We stayed 10 days, had a great time. Loved all the pools & beach area. Very Clean.  Great area for local attractions. Awesome friendly Staff.  We would stay again.   Loved seeing the big ships everyday. The sunsets were another perk.

We were at the resort for a one week break from winter, and loved it. Our experience there was great from beginning to end.  We were quickly processed upon arrival and in our room, unpacked within half an hour.  Due to our late arrival, we went to the buffet.  The staff in the buffet restaurant are great.  So quick to acknowledge you and assist with most requests. The al a cart restaurants were wonderful.  No reservations were required.  And again, wonderful staff.   Our garden view room was nice, clean, and comfortable. Everything we needed for our sleeping comfort.  The pathways around the resort are coral stone and very uneven.   We did meet a couple of people that had tripped and fallen.  One girl, that was there to celebrate a friend’s birthday, had a fall that left a huge

Our stay was a 2 week stay for my wife and I.  Very friendly staff through out the facility. There are many activities for young and old as well. Rooms are kept spotless! Very relaxing environment. I liked that you could see colorful fish right from the beach as they supply snorkeling equipment.

Very nice, freindly hotel overall. Disagreed with covered shoe requirement for men at the italian restaurant as the women could still wear open toed shoes. Unless this policy is changed , we will never eat there again.

I visited Grand Park Royal Cozumel in March with my husband, 5 year old son, and my parents (in their early 60s). We had a good time overall, no major complaints, just a few minor annoyances. The resort is small compared to many I've been to, but has a lot packed into it. There is an adults-only pool area that looked enjoyable, but we didn't venture there. There is an app for the resort (it's useful, but definitely lacking) I'd suggest downloading, and know that the PIN is your room number!  There were multiple bars and a few snack areas, so we were always able to grab a drink or bite to eat. However, if you have any food allergies you might find the food options difficult. My husband has a severe dairy allergy, and it was difficult at each restaurant we went to to find food

It was a great place to vacation especially for the price. Food was good, service was good and loads of memories made! Adult pool was pleasant. Snorkeling just off the beach at the resort as well. Highly recommend!

This was our first trip to Cozumel, but our 11th to Mexico. This resort was beautiful and lush with vegetation and had a lot of neat architectural features that highlight the Mayan culture. It does have a small beach area and great snorkeling steps from the beach.  However, I don't think I would recommend this place to friends. The service was not up to par with what we've experienced at other resorts in Mexico.  The start of our trip began with the timeshare spiel which we quickly dismissed. When it was time to check in, there was confusion on what we had booked versus what Expedia had recorded. They said they would look into it, but never did.
