Well located within walking distance to the pier where the dive boats depart. This is not an all-inclusive resort, it’s a well run hotel. So, if that’s what you are looking for then look no further.

The employees are awesome, and I appreciated the recommendations.  Breakfast was great, although a la carte instead of buffet due to covd.  Clean spacious rooms, great water pressure and comfy beds.  I feel like the properties is stuck in the 1990s though.  I would love to come back whenever they do a remodel.

I wanted to try a different hotel other than the one I usually use. Casa Mexicana is not where I had booked. It's where I ended up. I booked Suites Colonial. The first problem was the shuttle driver couldn't find the hotel. After asking for directions several times, he finally dropped me off at the location of the hotel. It was closed. Again, IT WAS CLOSED! The business next door called the number on the iron gate. I was directed  to walk four blocks with my SCUBA gear and luggage?! I was, however, met 2/3 of the way by an employee.   I chose to try Suites Colonial because of its close proximity to the dive shop I use. Casa Mexicana, although nice, is further than I had in mind. If Suites Colonial is no longer in operation, then it should be so stated and Tripadvisor readers be

We had the best time staying at Casa Mexicana! It was our first time in Cozumel and I'm so glad I found this place. It's waterfront and you can walk anywhere you need to go in town (restaurants, dive shops, taxis, etc.). Even from the back corner of the hotel, we had an ocean view from the balcony. We were diving with Aldora and the shop was right around the corner. They picked us up each morning at the pier right in front of the hotel so it was super convenient. Breakfast was included and was great! Had authentic Mexican options which was wonderful and we could place our order the night before to reserve a table and speed up the process in the morning before diving. The pool was small but a nice place to relax after a long day. The staff was so friendly and was patient with me

We recently stayed at the Casa Mexicana for the 5th time. The past trips were always great and we would rate the Casa Mexicana one of our favorite places to stay in Cozumel. Needless to say, a lot has changed due to COVID. The fabulous breakfast buffet is now gone. The breakfast you get is real limited. You order from a menu with a few items on it. The service was slow and you had to ask for everything, i.e. toast, juice etc.. We ordered an omelet. All that was on the plate was the omelet. No toast, fruit or anything! Even when they had the buffet, the servers always checked on you. Not anymore! We had to go up to the juice machine and get a refill on our juice. In the past when we checked in, you would get a hot towel, a cold drink, and a hearty welcome. This time there was

Casa Mexicana is our go-to in Cozumel. Location, price and customer service are beyond spectacular. Sad the buffet is temporarily down - that certainly is a highlight of our stay every time. Hopefully not for long as we are returning soon.

It is waterfront. View is spectacular. When going up the escalator there is an awful smell...unsure of what exactly it was. The place is much smaller than it appears to be. It was a very busy and loud area. the food and service was very good! Loved Cozumel!

This hotel is right on the the ocean and two blocks south of the main square. It it within easy walking distance of everything in town. A Starbucks is right around the corner, near the ferry, dive shops, taxis and great restaurants. Lobby is on the second floor so despite that fact that it is on the Main Street it is above the fray and quiet. We stayed on the fifth floor in an oceanfront room with a balcony. Free WiFi (could be stronger but I was able to conduct business), free yummy to order breakfast with a very friendly and responsive wait staff. Reasonably priced bar, lounge area with sofas and chairs,  a small pool with an incredible view. Firm beds and clean spacious rooms with big balconies and an in room fridge. Thanks Casa Mexicana for a great stay we will be back soon!

Very nice and fantastic location with easy access from the street to the main lobby, the room was nice with king bed and balcony to the ocean, the AC do not cool below 22 even when I lowered the minimum to 16 everything looks clean and well maintained with friendly staff, the pool area is located in the main level by the Lobby with nice terrace facing to the ocean and have a good tan during the afternoon daylight sun and its sunset in top of the horizon ocean. Definitely I would be back again

Thank you to Graciela for the top class communication. Too sad the breakfast buffet was not there anymore, we were looking forward to that. Understand the reasoning though, this whole COVID thing is getting old.   As always, hotel was clean, staff was friendly, no issues.

I really liked this place.  The staff was nice and very helpful. I got a balcony with great views of the ocean. The rooms were clean. The things that they need to fix is the water pressure for the shower. I also really like that it was above a 711. I would totally stay here in the future.

We absolutely love Casa Mexicana.  We have stayed at a number of places on the Island, and have decided to make Casa Mexicana our go to place.  We have now stayed there about 5 times over the last few years.  Super friendly staff, very clean, beautiful views from the ocean-view rooms, and wonderful breakfast.  The hotel was able to schedule our Covid test to fly home,  which was one less thing to co-ordinate. The hotel has air conditioning and a small pool with deck chairs.  It is on the main road, so no beach if that is what you are into.  We use to be at some of the all-inclusive and now we love staying at Casa Mexicana because we can walk all over town and visit the many great restaurants.  Highly recommend Casa Cuzamil (coconut shrimp/garlic shrimp), La Casita de Indio's

I stayed one night here and found it to be very clean with  polite and helpful staff. The included breakfast was very good and all the staff were aware of Covid protocols. It is within easy walking distance from the Winjet ferry terminal and is centrally located along the waterfront within walking distance of shops and restaurants. I felt safe in the area, as a solo traveler, and would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Disclaimer--long time Mexico traveler, I don't expect perfection at all, but for the price, I think there is much room for improvement.  The Pros:  Great location right on the main road, 7-11 next door for supplies, pretty lobby and pool area overlooking the ocean.  Very convenient to everything.  Breakfast buffet is served from 7:30 am to 12:30 pm, and was great, manned by a gentleman who was intent on making everyone go all the way to the ground floor, and walk back up the stairs so he could check your temp and get your room number---basically backtracking--even though you get off the elevator at the 2nd floor, where the breakfast is being served....we watched him literally lecture everyone about it, as no one knew.  Buffet servers were nice, friendly, and made giant custom

This is my second stay here, both for one week to dive, and love this place.  I love the rooms on the terrace.  Everything works, is spotless, has fast internet, is extremely safe, quiet,  and charming with the pool just above the malecon.  Breakfast is included and you have Mexican choices or omelets, waffles, pancakes, etc.  I have been told normally they have a huge buffet, but covid is preventing that.  There is a 7-11 smack downstairs and a huge market with anything you need less than a 5 min. walk.  The Aqua Safari dive shop is 2 doors down, and the dive boat picks me up right across the road.  How much better can it get than that?  Maybe one thing:  I see a fridge below the TV in a cabinet and it's not plugged in.

We enjoyed our stay at the Casa Mexicana.  It is in a great location for wandering around downtown Cozumel.  Our room was clean and comfortable, and had a nice balcony.  The included breakfast was fresh and delicious.  We arrived just before a small hurricane, and the hotel had room service available for us (since all of the restaurants were closed).  The wifi was not always very strong, and I often had to stand by the doorway to our room or else head out to the lobby to get connected.  Other than that, we really enjoyed it!

Nice room and lobby area. Friendly staff, and clean throughout. Pool and terrace is adequate. Located within easy walking distance of shopping, groceries, and restaurants. Breakfast was included and was above standard.  Total experience is fairly priced.

Second time staying at this hotel.  It continues to be wonderful.  Clean, spacious, and location is awesome.  Walking distance to tons of things.  The staff are incredible.  Cudos to Luis, the bartender at the lobby bar, and Sinthia, the hostess at the breakfast buffet.  Food is amazing.  View from the balcony was beautiful.  Definitely recommend!

We sit here on the top floor of the hotel, the view from the balcony of our ocean view room is charming.  Our room seems well-maintained and it is spotlessly clean. It is cleaned by, indeed the entire hotel is staffed by, the most pleasant people you could want to deal with. Elizabeth cooked my eggs to order every morning and Sinthia, well Sinthia was attentive to our every need and she makes a really good classic margarita. Reviews to the contrary smack of issues with those reviewers.  Oh, that’s unkind, let’s just stay that there are so few of those reviews that it is likely an inevitable bad day was involved.  We found the staff unfailingly invariably civil, cheerful, friendly, hardworking and truly helpful.  Some of the other guests, not so much. We plan to return.  The

Let me start this review of Casa Mexicana by saying that this is the first hotel experience I have had in a long time that I am leaving with nothing to say negative. From the time I was greeted with a cool drink, to check in, having the specific room I requested, to check out, it was one positive experience after another. This team, and I wish I knew every name, works together to offer the best experience possible. I have stayed at what is considered as 5-star hotels that need to learn customer service and facility maintenance from Casa Mexicana. Again, I wish I had every name that I had contact with but, Carlos (new hire), Darwin, Graciela, and Anibal went above and beyond. Everything worked!!!! The room TV, the lights, the bathroom, (did I say the bathroom), the comfortable

This was our 4th stay at the hotel but first since 2019.  The hotel was showing a little wear around the edges but the staff just goes out of their way to make every experience as comfortable and easy as possible.  Good location for access to the town center and the pool/open lobby area on the 2nd level is a great place to watch the sunset or just activity on the street.  The staff was constantly cleaning public areas.  No doubt we will stay there again on our next visit.

Overall, we had a really enjoyable experience.  Older hotel in downtown area, but the price is set accurately to offset the cons.   Very clean and safe hotel. Free breakfast is very good.  Cooks work very hard to please your requests.  Staff here is wonderful.  Pool was nice and bartender made nice strong drinks.    Hotel does get a little noisy in the morning due to the echoes.  We used a white noise app to sleep and never heard anything again. Water pressure in shower was good and plenty of hot water, however the shower head needs replaced.    We would stay here again for the price we paid.

We had the city view on the 2nd floor, seeing the sunrise, and the treetops from bed each morning were beautiful.   Nice pool tp relax by or in.  The wifi was good and accessible everywhere within the hotel and at the pool.  The breakfast was nice and easy every morning and it was a little different each day.   It was so nice eating in the open courtyard.  We will be back for sure, I don't see a reason to stay anywhere else.

We had a very good experience at this hotel. The location is great. It is easy to walk around the town. It is about 4 blocks from the ferry pier. The staff are very helpful. The room was clean. The beds were good. The shower was OK. The room has a safe. The breakfast was excellent.  The staff was able to arrange for a med tech to come to our room for the Covid rapid antigen test. The results were returned to our email in 1 hour. The cost was $25. The result... Negative...was priceless. This hotel was an exception bargain. I would stay here again.

Nice hotel, the room was clean and quiet. We had a city view room, facing backside of the hotel. Very nice.  All the staff was helpful and polite.  Sinthia is an exceptional breakfast staff member, so pleasant every morning, and busy taking care of the guests. We hope she's there when we come back!  The food from the buffet was good, if anything it could be a little hotter.

Nice hotel, great service special Sinthia on the breakfast. Fair price and all team are very helpful. Good location, about 10 min walk from downtown/ferry boat. Spacious rooms, pretty clean. In front of the sea but no beach.  I’d rate it 3+ star

Great helpful staff, very clean and comfortable.  Better than expected stay!  I liked that the curtains darkened the room well and I enjoyed the breakfast.  Also they were helpful with our special little requests.

We stayed here for one night before going to the resort that we had booked.  The hotel is in a great location, in close proximity to restaurants, souvenir shops and the Mega store. Check-in was very fast and the service was excellent. The breakfast that was included was delicious.  Our room was okay. We had a room that overlooked one of the side streets, although we could see the sea if we looked out to our right when we stood on our balcony. Our only complaint really was that we had an adjoining room and we could hear everything next door, including the arguing. We would definitely stay here again, although I would probably pay the extra money for an oceanfront room the next time.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We had an ocean view room with an exterior balcony. The non-ocean view rooms have a balcony that faces inward from what I could see. The property was clean, the employees were friendly & efficient. We wanted to book a last-minute excursion and all 3 of the people at the front desk were immediately on the phone trying to accommodate us. This hotel is almost directly across from Punta Langosta pier, downtown. One or two ships would dock each day. The ships do not block your view by any means and it's kinda fun watching them and the people come and go. There is no access to the water nearby. The pool is very small and VERY warm with a nice sitting area that overlooks the street. I read reviews that the higher levels had less noise in the

I have  stayed  here on many occasions over the past 20 years- including when I arrive a day or 2 early before my condo is available . It is utterly spotless, they have long term staff, a lovely lounge and truly the best breakfast in town - all for a great price. I am next on the Island in Feb and April and look forward to using CM to get settled  and rested before heading to my place out of town down the island . It is located on the Main Street so if you want to pay a bit more for water view that's great - all rooms have balconies

The hotel is well located. The rooms are clean, a little bit dark. The food at breakfast is good, not a lot of choices, but still is good. The staff are nice. You have free fresh water at the lobby and there’s a 7 eleven 1 min. walk from the hotel. Great experience.

Stayed for two nights before going to an all inclusive.  Beautiful property.  Staff is superb.  Small pool, but nice.  Very clean. Complimentary breakfast. Very good.  This seems to be a place for adults only.  One guest was playing a blue tooth speak and they requested it to be turned down.  This is NOT a party hotel.  Elegant and downtown.

The hotel is older, which would not matter if the staff appeared to care.  The first night, our room was dirty, our shower only had cold water and the ocean view we paid for was blocked by dirty windows.  When I approached the front desk, they asked “What do you want me to do?” Later they were able to provide a new room but the mini fridge didn’t work. We reported it again and they never came.  We reported it a third time and they told us they would come in the morning, but showed up at 10:30pm at night when we were already in bed.  Furthermore, they had 4 beers, a couple waters and a couple cokes in the min fridge. They refilled in once in our 8 day stay.  Even when we requested they never came.  We had to go to the literally go down to front desk to request more.  The

App isn’t accurate on opening times of restaurants. Restaurants are closed when app says open. Toilet issues every day. Entire resort is in desperate need of a total upgrade. In various states of disrepair. Either have scalding hot water or cold water for showers. No in between. Appears to be very understaffed. Food was decent. We have visited several secrets and were caught off guard and overall disappointed by the condition of the room and resort overall. Beaches were great. Staff that showed up was friendly and worked very hard. Probably would not come back to this secrets without a major renovation

Why does their sewage treatment plant smell up the area.  it is horrible and affects the air all around.    Nobody should stay there until they correct this issue.  They are also terrible neighbors to the surrounding property

The views were absolutely beautiful. Our favorite part was the entertainment team. They always had a smile on their faces, and you could tell they genuinely enjoyed their jobs, especially Heydy, Adriana, Fabiola, and Eduardo. They made the entire soo fun for us!

Went during spring break, but your wouldn't have known by the crowd. It was very quiet and low-key except for a few drunk adults.  Check in went smoothly. I actually book for one instead of two, but they were able to just add the AI part for my husband. Not a big deal.  We did not book preferred. Our room was not updated and it was beaten up. The corners of the walls had chunks missing, the tint on our balcony was torn and the shower smelled like sewer. Seems like these are minor things that could be fixed, so it's a little annoying that they leave things this way. I had read prior reviews so I still disappointed, but not surprised. On a positive note, the rooms was huge, and our ocean view was beautiful.  Buffet was good, Windows was good, and Bordeaux, was very good. We ate

We have been home for a week and can’t get the musty smell out of my clothes after multiple washings. The best part is the entertainment team. They are spectacular!! The front desk people write down your requests, but nothing happens. The hotel is situated so there is not a lot of beach to walk up and down. We will not be returning here until it has a facelift!!!

We upgraded to the preferred room. The plus side is that our room is very quiet, we have a beautiful view of the ocean. However, the room is in serious need of repair. They clearly put a smaller TV on the wall and there are huge holes exposed. There is not one painting on the wall. It literally looks like a prism. the room is very worn and in need of repair. It looks nothing like how it is advertised. The food is highly mediocre and there are many things in the hotel that are not working or not open. The gym has a few pieces of equipment that are not working, and when we arrived at 7 AM, there were no towels, and no water. in addition, they do nothing to replace the towels, so on our day of arrival, when we went to the beach at 3 PM, there were no towels to be found. The hotel is a little older, but things are very clean and upkept. Appear maintenance is working behind the scenes to make more updates. Food was amazing although sushi was closed. Some entertainment, but overall a pretty quiet resort. Taxis were east to get. Swim up bars were stocked.   Recommendation for the resort: work to get the pools filled a bit more, and all of the skimmers working.

Wonderful getaway to clear water, hot sun, cold drinks, and good people all around. All-inclusive food & drink and activities made for zero stress. Pool volleyball with Eduardo every day was a highlight of the trip. Mojito class with Adriana was delicious. The clientele were the best part - new old friends. We look forward to a Secrets getaway again soon!

My wife and I just returned from a one week getaway at this beach resort.  While the physical plant seems a little dated, it it still modern by our standards of what we have come to expect at a secrets resort, marble floors, comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms and all nicely laid out on a property that is closer than most resorts to the ocean….the newly built resorts are all set back from the beach much farther…..so we like this proximity to the beach and water   The beach is a nice soft sand, but the entry into the water is rocky with coral in spots, so you will appreciate using water shoes as it will eliminate the discomfort of the rocky entry…..when the water is calm, it has that Caribbean blue hue and it offers wonderful snorkelling. The people and the location made this a wonderful vacation for us.  We loved being able to access Sunscape and Dreams also, just a short walk away.  Having the pier right there to go on our snorkel excursion made it so easy and convenient.  They offer lots of fun activities throughout the week.  We were able to kayak, bike, do yoga, and fun games in the pool.  The hotel is in need of renovation in some areas but the staff works so hard to make things nice.  We were really impressed with the food.  Great selection of restaurants.  Olio was excellent.  And enjoyed lots of sunsets at Oceana.  We would like the thank the following staff for making our trip a wonderful one:  Yatmara in UVC, Sarah (activity dept) Vladimir (Amstar) They all went above and beyond for us!  Thank you!!

The entertainment team at Secrets was simply the best and made our vacation such a great time. Our favorite guys Aaron and Erick fit right in with our group and we would travel back there again to hang out with them.

We had a wonderful stay. Wanted to extend specific gratitude to a few employees who really made our trip feel valued.  1) Aranzazu greeted us upon our arrival and was so incredible warm, knowledgeable, and engaging. She checked in on us, expressed genuine interest in our stay and our family, and was a wonderful host.  2) Elizabeth was a waitress at the market cafe and was simply incredible. The resort staff was wonderful. They welcomed u drinks right when u got there and got u information for your room. From there it place went down hill. There is no activities after 4 pm unless u pay extra for excursion.  There is no local breakfast unless u want room service. Otherwise u have to walk over to next hotel. If u are a preferred member then u can eat breakfast and lunch at oceana the local restaurant at hotel. We were given a bottle of tequila in our room first day. But it was removed the following morning. We asked why and if it could be replaced nothing was done about it. Our shower flooded the bathroom after using it. We went to front desk no changes were made. We upgraded to ocean view walk up pool, first day great.. next three pool was never cleaned. Was green

My husband and I have been to.Mexico all inclusives over five times so decided to try an adults only all inclusive at Secrets thinking it would be a step up above all the other family type resorts. We were very surprised to find Secrets Cozumel to be the least glamorous of all the resorts we have stayed at. We had a regular pool side room that seemed like a stay at a holiday inn. Nothing special.   We quickly found that unless you paid for an upgrade to a prestigious member, your choice of breakfast and lunch was at one buffet at the far side of the grounds. You could order a basic lunch by the pool or by the beach chairs but you waited quite a bit to receive it.   I have to say the staff was amazing. Always polite and generally very happy. Definitely not enough staff working

I was very happy with my recent trip to Secrets Aura in Cozumel. All of the negative reviews had me worried before leaving but I am so happy I didn't change our reservation. The hotel property is gorgeous! Staff does an amazing job keeping it clean, everything from the rooms, pools, beach, and walkways. Our room was perfect- comfy bed, A/C, and  fridge worked! We had a pool swim up room with a water slide right out front- so fun! The food was delicious, especially Windows! All staff is super nice especially the activities staff- Christian remembered our names from day 1 and always made sure to chit chat with us. The beach is a little rocky but we still enjoyed swimming in the ocean! We would definitely come back to Secrets!

The entertainment team was tireless. Heidi’s aqua workout class was out of this world. She is so funny, kind and energetic. The whole team was great and I enjoyed many conversations with Christian, Eduardo, Adriana, and fabulous.   Executive chef Mario at Bordeaux’s was extremely good at his job. He really cared about the quality of the food as well as the dining experience. He even made us a special dairy free delicious dessert. Israel was a great server at Bordeaux. He got all of our order right.  Sergio, the breakfast room service guy always came in with a smile, and carried the tray up two flights of stairs with ease.

Entertainment team was amazing! Christian and the others did an awesome job with the activities.  They were well organized and super engaging for everyone! From bingo pool side, to volleyball. They always had smiles on their faces and super accomdating! Do not miss out on the water balloon fight! Again special shout out to Christian great job my friend!

Just wanted to give a shout out to the entertainment staff ! Fabiola , Eduardo , Adrianna , Heydy , Christian . They were fantastic! Always on the go and wanting everyone to join in ! Fantastic week spent in the sun and sand ! There was always something happening. Saw lots of friends that we have know on staff for sometime now !

The hotel it self is older. We had a pool walkout and we hung out at the pool most of the days. There were only 2 servers taking care of the guest in the pool area and the beach. Gilberto y Miguel. These guys were non stop from getting drinks and food for everyone on time to keeping the area clean. I walk out my room, before I can say hi they already have our drink order ready to be served.  In Ocean side restaurant. We went there for breakfast every morning. The restaurant is divided in two for the two servers working the restaurant. Again my drinks are ready and filled and the food was delivered hot and on time. Another Miguel took care of us there.  If it wasn’t for the great service these gentlemen delivered. It would’ve been a sub par resort.   Thank you Gilberto, Miguel

Over all, the resort is fairly nice ...but it isn't as nice as I remember from my previous three stays. There were 16 in our group; some mix-up with rooms-but was provided a room with a great balcony. Too many restrictions as to when one can eat at certain restaurants. The beach is still really nice and the swim-up bars still fun; however, the back pool could be kept up a bit better.  The property had rolling blackouts the first couple of days of our visit which caused no AC in a few of the rooms during the night. The food was not bad; some was actually really good. Unfortunately, we most likely won't stay there again, especially at the price we paid.

The food and drinks are amazing. Miguel Sanchez at the Oceanna restaurant took great care of us throughout our stay! I would definitely recommend staying at the Secrets Aura Cozumel Resort it was a great experience.

Just make sure you stay at Dreams. Aura really is pretty nasty and I set my expectations low: just wanting to dive/snorkel. So service was really great. But rooms do stink. Food is meh (for the price) Swim up pool was so slimy.  We made the best of it but…ewww

I wish I could give 3.5 stars.  This is my second time at the hotel and the reason we came back was the ability to snorkel right off the beach.  Unfortunately, there were no fish anywhere to be seen when we were there.  Maybe it was a weather thing or maybe this is the new normal at this resort. I will say that the food has definitely improved from when I stayed here in 2019.  The service is still mostly good but it seemed like each day we were there it got a little bit slower. Felipe at the back pool bar is awesome as is Armando, one of the waiters in Oceana. Vincente in the preferred lounge was the opposite.  He seemed annoyed any time we saw him and by the end of the trip we were avoiding the preferred lounge just so we didn't have to deal with him.  Overall it was a good

Will never visit again. First, the resort is run down and not as nice as some of the other AM Resorts we have been to. Second, As UCV members we used our VIP week for this trip and  were treated poorly. UVC is not worth it when you don’t get a preferred upgrade and are treated like trash and sent to the worst room at the resort. We felt like we were being punished for using our VIP week. We even tried to pay extra for an upgrade and were told that no rooms were available (which was not true).  Food was not good. Resort is poorly lauded out and you feel like you are in a maze. Overall, would not recommend and we will not be back. We will also not be renewing our UVC when our contract is up.

I was disappointed with this stay. I have always heard great things about Secrets and how these resorts are top of the line. I had high expectations going in, with what I'd heard about Secrets and with it being adults only. We were preferred so we were taken to a preferred only lounge to get checked in. Our party was 10 with 5 rooms, and it took about an hour to get all checked in. They had snacks in the preferred lounge and a bar, which was nice after flying, but I'm not sure why it takes an hour to get people checked in to 5 rooms. The other thing was, we had asked back when we booked in January for all of our rooms to be close, and they did not honor this or try to do this at all, even after several requests during the check in process. But whatever, we finally got the

The service was fantastic at all the restaurants! We enjoyed the personalized service at the Oceana were we had lunch everyday! We greatly appreciated our hostess Locia, and waiters Miguel Sanchez and Miguel Canche and Carolina Cardena

No secrets standards at all. No entertaining at midnight or midday. Service it’s terrible the only restaurant that has secrets standards Bordeaux. No A/C for breakfast at any restaurant. We were without A/C and Internet for 12 hours it was awful and no tv control  and I can go on. Do not make a mistake coming to this Secret Aura Cozumel.

My wife and I stayed at Secrets in Cozumel.  It is a nice facility.  We were in the preferred level which according to the information has some better food, drinks and a preferred only pool with a swim up bar.  But, the pool experience was not good.  In fact, it was terrible at times.  The company that owns Secrets also has a Sunscape and a Dreams resort next door.  They allow people from Dreams to come use the facilities at Secrets.  They came to the Preferred pool which is supposed to be for the preferred at Secrets.  We paid substantially more for the preferred level.  The Dreams people openly said there were a lot of kids at the Dreams pool so they came over to Secrets which is adults only.  It might be OK to go to the standard level pool at Secrets, but they let them come

My husband and I stayed here two years ago three nights in a row we lost power which made for a very hot night but we thought we would give it another try so we went 5/28/23-06/03/23…. BIG MISTAKE!!
